parameter.name: ctl_bw
parameter.long_desc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameter.name: ctl_dir
parameter.long_desc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameter.name: ctl_gain
parameter.long_desc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased; systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a slower, smoother response.

parameter.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameter.long_desc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameter.name: ctl_start_rate
parameter.long_desc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameter.name: esc_index
parameter.short_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameter.long_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameter.name: id_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status ID

parameter.name: int_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameter.name: int_status
parameter.long_desc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameter.name: mot_i_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameter.name: mot_kv
parameter.short_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameter.long_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameter.name: mot_ls
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameter.name: mot_num_poles
parameter.long_desc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_rs
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_v_accel
parameter.long_desc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameter.name: mot_v_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the motor current limit.

parameter.name: gnss.dyn_model
parameter.long_desc: Dynamic model used in the GNSS positioning engine. 0 – Automotive, 1 – Sea, 2 – Airborne.

parameter.name: gnss.old_fix_msg
parameter.long_desc: Broadcast the old (deprecated) GNSS fix message uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix alongside the new alternative uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix2. It is recommended to disable this feature to reduce the CAN bus traffic.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_dimens
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the dimensionality of the GNSS solution is less than this value. 3 for the full (3D) solution, 2 for planar (2D) solution, 1 for time-only solution, 0 disables the feature.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_sats
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: uavcan.pubp-pres
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: ADSB_CALLSIGN_1
parameter.long_desc: Sets first 4 characters of a total of 8. Valid characters are A-Z, 0-9, " ". Example "PX4 " -> 1347957792 For CALLSIGN shorter than 8 characters use the null terminator at the end '\0'.

parameter.name: ADSB_CALLSIGN_2
parameter.long_desc: Sets second 4 characters of a total of 8. Valid characters are A-Z, 0-9, " " only. Example "TEST" -> 1413829460 For CALLSIGN shorter than 8 characters use the null terminator at the end '\0'.

parameter.name: ADSB_EMERGC
parameter.long_desc: Sets the vehicle emergency state

parameter.name: ADSB_EMIT_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Configure the emitter type of the vehicle.

parameter.name: ADSB_GPS_OFF_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Sets GPS lataral offset encoding

parameter.name: ADSB_GPS_OFF_LON
parameter.long_desc: Sets GPS longitudinal offset encoding

parameter.name: ADSB_ICAO_ID
parameter.long_desc: Defines the ICAO ID of the vehicle

parameter.name: ADSB_ICAO_SPECL
parameter.long_desc: This vehicle is always tracked. Use 0 to disable.

parameter.name: ADSB_IDENT
parameter.long_desc: Enable Identification of Position feature

parameter.name: ADSB_LEN_WIDTH
parameter.long_desc: Report the length and width of the vehicle in meters. In most cases, use '1' for the smallest vehicle size.

parameter.name: ADSB_LIST_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Change number of targets to track

parameter.name: ADSB_MAX_SPEED
parameter.long_desc: Informs ADSB vehicles of this vehicle's max speed capability

parameter.name: ADSB_SQUAWK
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the squawk code. Value should be between 0000 and 7777.

parameter.name: PCA9685_DUTY_EN
parameter.short_desc: Put the selected channels into Duty-Cycle output mode
parameter.long_desc: The driver will output standard pulse-width encoded signal without this bit set. To make PCA9685 output in duty-cycle fashion, please enable the corresponding channel bit here and adjusting standard params to suit your need. The driver will have 12bits resolution for duty-cycle output. That means to achieve 0% to 100% output range on one channel, the corresponding params MIN and MAX for the channel should be set to 0 and 4096. Other standard params follows the same rule.

parameter.name: PCA9685_PWM_FREQ
parameter.long_desc: Controls the PWM frequency at timing perspective. This is independent from PWM update frequency, as PCA9685 is capable to output without being continuously commanded by FC. Higher frequency leads to more accurate pulse width, but some ESCs and servos may not support it. This parameter should be set to the same value as PWM update rate in most case. This parameter MUST NOT exceed upper limit of 400.0, if any outputs as generic 1000~2000us pulse width is desired. Frequency higher than 400 only makes sense in duty-cycle mode.

parameter.name: PCA9685_REV
parameter.short_desc: Reverse Output Range for PCA9685 Output
parameter.long_desc: Allows to reverse the output range for each channel. Note: this is only useful for servos.

parameter.name: PCA9685_SCHD_HZ
parameter.long_desc: Controls the update rate of PWM output. Flight Controller will inform those numbers of update events in a second, to PCA9685. Higher update rate will consume more I2C bandwidth, which may even lead to worse output latency, or completely block I2C bus.

parameter.name: VTQ_IO_REV
parameter.short_desc: Reverse Output Range for Vertiq IO
parameter.long_desc: Allows to reverse the output range for each channel. Note: this is only useful for servos.

parameter.name: ASPD_BETA_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for sideslip angle fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: ASPD_BETA_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Sideslip measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ASPD_DO_CHECKS
parameter.long_desc: Controls which checks are run to check airspeed data for validity. Only applied if ASPD_PRIMARY > 0.

bitmask.bit: Only data missing check (triggers if more than 1s no data)
Data stuck (triggers if data is exactly constant for 2s in FW mode)
Load factor check (triggers if measurement is below stall speed)
First principle check (airspeed change vs. throttle and pitch)

parameter.name: ASPD_FALLBACK_GW
parameter.short_desc: Enable fallback to sensor-less airspeed estimation
parameter.long_desc: If set to true and airspeed checks are enabled, it will use a sensor-less airspeed estimation based on groundspeed minus windspeed if no other airspeed sensor available to fall back to.

parameter.name: ASPD_FP_T_WINDOW
parameter.short_desc: First principle airspeed check time window
parameter.long_desc: Window for comparing airspeed change to throttle and pitch change. Triggers when the airspeed change within this window is negative while throttle increases and the vehicle pitches down. Is meant to catch degrading airspeed blockages as can happen when flying through icing conditions. Relies on FW_THR_TRIM being set accurately.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_INNOV
parameter.long_desc: This specifies the minimum airspeed innovation required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller values make it more sensitive. Large innovations indicate an inconsistency between predicted (groundspeed - windspeeed) and measured airspeed. The time required to detect a fault when the threshold is exceeded depends on the size of the exceedance and is controlled by the ASPD_FS_INTEG parameter.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_INTEG
parameter.long_desc: This sets the time integral of airspeed innovation exceedance above ASPD_FS_INNOV required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller positive values make it more sensitive.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_T_START
parameter.long_desc: Delay before switching back to using airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is good. Set to a negative value to disable the re-enabling in flight.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_T_STOP
parameter.long_desc: Delay before stopping use of airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is bad.

parameter.name: ASPD_PRIMARY
parameter.short_desc: Index or primary airspeed measurement source

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_1
parameter.long_desc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the first airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_2
parameter.long_desc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the second airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_3
parameter.long_desc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the third airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_APPLY
parameter.short_desc: Controls when to apply the new estimated airspeed scale(s)

values.value: Do not automatically apply the estimated scale
Apply the estimated scale after disarm
Apply the estimated scale in air

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_NSD
parameter.short_desc: Wind estimator true airspeed scale process noise spectral density
parameter.long_desc: Airspeed scale process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector. When unaided, the scale uncertainty (1-sigma, unitless) increases by this amount every second.

parameter.name: ASPD_TAS_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for true airspeed fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: ASPD_TAS_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Wind estimator true airspeed measurement noise
parameter.long_desc: True airspeed measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ASPD_WERR_THR
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal wind uncertainty threshold for synthetic airspeed
parameter.long_desc: The synthetic airspeed estimate (from groundspeed and heading) will be declared valid as soon and as long the horizontal wind uncertainty is below this value.

parameter.name: ASPD_WIND_NSD
parameter.short_desc: Wind estimator wind process noise spectral density
parameter.long_desc: Wind process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector. When unaided, the wind estimate uncertainty (1-sigma, in m/s) increases by this amount every second.

parameter.name: ATT_ACC_COMP
parameter.short_desc: Acceleration compensation based on GPS velocity

parameter.name: ATT_EN
parameter.long_desc: Enable standalone quaternion based attitude estimator.

parameter.name: ATT_EXT_HDG_M
parameter.short_desc: External heading usage mode (from Motion capture/Vision)
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to use heading estimate from vision. Set to 2 to use heading from motion capture.

parameter.name: ATT_MAG_DECL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is not used in normal operation, as the declination is looked up based on the GPS coordinates of the vehicle.

parameter.name: ATT_W_MAG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to avoid using the magnetometer.

parameter.name: FW_AT_APPLY
parameter.short_desc: Controls when to apply the new gains
parameter.long_desc: After the auto-tuning sequence is completed, a new set of gains is available and can be applied immediately or after landing.

values.value: Do not apply the new gains (logging only)
Apply the new gains after disarm
Apply the new gains in air

parameter.name: FW_AT_AXES
parameter.long_desc: Defines which axes will be tuned during the auto-tuning sequence Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Roll 1 : Pitch 2 : Yaw

parameter.name: FW_AT_MAN_AUX
parameter.short_desc: Enable/disable auto tuning using an RC AUX input
parameter.long_desc: Defines which RC_MAP_AUXn parameter maps the RC channel used to enable/disable auto tuning.

parameter.name: FW_AT_START
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: this will inject steps to the rate controller and can be dangerous. Only activate if you know what you are doing, and in a safe environment. Any motion of the remote stick will abort the signal injection and reset this parameter Best is to perform the identification in position or hold mode. Increase the amplitude of the injected signal using FW_AT_SYSID_AMP for more signal/noise ratio

parameter.name: FW_AT_SYSID_AMP
parameter.long_desc: This parameter scales the signal sent to the rate controller during system identification.

parameter.name: FW_AT_SYSID_F0
parameter.short_desc: Start frequency of the injected signal
parameter.long_desc: Can be set lower or higher than the end frequency

parameter.name: FW_AT_SYSID_F1
parameter.short_desc: End frequency of the injected signal
parameter.long_desc: Can be set lower or higher than the start frequency

parameter.name: FW_AT_SYSID_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Duration of the input signal sent on each axis during system identification

parameter.name: FW_AT_SYSID_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Type of signal used during system identification to excite the system.

parameter.name: MC_AT_APPLY
parameter.short_desc: Controls when to apply the new gains
parameter.long_desc: After the auto-tuning sequence is completed, a new set of gains is available and can be applied immediately or after landing. WARNING Applying the gains in air is dangerous as there is no guarantee that those new gains will be able to stabilize the drone properly.

values.value: Do not apply the new gains (logging only)
Apply the new gains after disarm
WARNING Apply the new gains in air

parameter.name: MC_AT_RISE_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Desired angular rate closed-loop rise time

parameter.name: MC_AT_START
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: this will inject steps to the rate controller and can be dangerous. Only activate if you know what you are doing, and in a safe environment. Any motion of the remote stick will abort the signal injection and reset this parameter Best is to perform the identification in position or hold mode. Increase the amplitude of the injected signal using MC_AT_SYSID_AMP for more signal/noise ratio

parameter.name: BAT1_A_PER_V
parameter.long_desc: The voltage seen by the ADC multiplied by this factor will determine the battery current. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT1_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 1 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT1_I_CHANNEL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter specifies the ADC channel used to monitor current of main power battery. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT1_I_OVERWRITE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter allows to overwrite the current measured during idle (unarmed) state with a user-defined constant value (expressed in amperes). When the system is armed, the measured current is used. This is useful because on certain ESCs current measurements are inaccurate in case of no load. Negative values are ignored and will cause the measured current to be used. The default value of 0 disables the overwrite, in which case the measured value is always used.

parameter.name: BAT1_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT1_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 1
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used instead of the online estimated internal resistance.

parameter.name: BAT1_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT1_V_CHANNEL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter specifies the ADC channel used to monitor voltage of main power battery. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT1_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full. For a more accurate estimate set this below the nominal voltage of e.g. 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT1_V_DIV
parameter.long_desc: This is the divider from battery 1 voltage to ADC voltage. If using e.g. Mauch power modules the value from the datasheet can be applied straight here. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT1_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen above the steep dropoff at 3.5V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged under high load down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT2_A_PER_V
parameter.long_desc: The voltage seen by the ADC multiplied by this factor will determine the battery current. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT2_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 2 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT2_I_CHANNEL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter specifies the ADC channel used to monitor current of main power battery. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT2_I_OVERWRITE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter allows to overwrite the current measured during idle (unarmed) state with a user-defined constant value (expressed in amperes). When the system is armed, the measured current is used. This is useful because on certain ESCs current measurements are inaccurate in case of no load. Negative values are ignored and will cause the measured current to be used. The default value of 0 disables the overwrite, in which case the measured value is always used.

parameter.name: BAT2_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT2_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 2
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used instead of the online estimated internal resistance.

parameter.name: BAT2_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT2_V_CHANNEL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter specifies the ADC channel used to monitor voltage of main power battery. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT2_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full. For a more accurate estimate set this below the nominal voltage of e.g. 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT2_V_DIV
parameter.long_desc: This is the divider from battery 2 voltage to ADC voltage. If using e.g. Mauch power modules the value from the datasheet can be applied straight here. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT2_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen above the steep dropoff at 3.5V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged under high load down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT3_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 3 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT3_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT3_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 3
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used instead of the online estimated internal resistance.

parameter.name: BAT3_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT3_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full. For a more accurate estimate set this below the nominal voltage of e.g. 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT3_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen above the steep dropoff at 3.5V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged under high load down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT_ADC_CHANNEL
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_I_CHANNEL

parameter.name: BAT_AVRG_CURRENT
parameter.long_desc: This value is used to initialize the in-flight average current estimation, which in turn is used for estimating remaining flight time and RTL triggering.

parameter.name: BAT_CRIT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as critically low. This has to be lower than the low threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger RTL.

parameter.name: BAT_EMERGEN_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as dangerously low. This has to be lower than the critical threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger landing.

parameter.name: BAT_LOW_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as low. This has to be higher than the critical threshold.

parameter.name: BAT_V_OFFS_CURR
parameter.short_desc: Offset in volt as seen by the ADC input of the current sensor
parameter.long_desc: This offset will be subtracted before calculating the battery current based on the voltage.

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the delay between image integration start and strobe firing

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_FBACK
parameter.long_desc: Enables camera capture feedback

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Change time measurement

values.value: Get timestamp of mid exposure (active high)
Get timestamp of mid exposure (active low)

parameter.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameter.name: TRIG_DISTANCE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the distance at which to trigger the camera.

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERFACE
parameter.long_desc: Selects the trigger interface

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameter.name: TRIG_MIN_INTERVA
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the minimum time between two consecutive trigger events the specific camera setup is supporting.

parameter.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = active low, 1 = active high )

parameter.name: TRIG_PWM_NEUTRAL
parameter.short_desc: PWM neutral output on trigger pin

parameter.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss, geofence, and takeoff failure detection safety logic.

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander, setting it to 0 keeps them enabled (recommended). We are generally recommending to not fly with the USB link connected and production vehicles should set this parameter to zero to prevent users from flying USB powered. However, for R&D purposes it has proven over the years to work just fine.

parameter.name: CBRK_VTOLARMING
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for arming in fixed-wing mode check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 159753 will enable arming in fixed-wing mode for VTOLs. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: COM_ACT_FAIL_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Set the actuator failure failsafe mode
parameter.long_desc: Note: actuator failure needs to be enabled and configured via FD_ACT_* parameters.

parameter.name: COM_ARMABLE
parameter.long_desc: Set 0 to prevent accidental use of the vehicle e.g. for safety or maintenance reasons.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_ID
parameter.long_desc: Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_MET
parameter.long_desc: Methods: - one arm: request authorization and arm when authorization is received - two step arm: 1st arm command request an authorization and 2nd arm command arm the drone if authorized Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ
parameter.long_desc: By default off. The default allows to arm the vehicle without a arm authorization.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_TO
parameter.long_desc: Timeout for authorizer answer. Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_BAT_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Threshold for battery percentage below arming is prohibited. A negative value means BAT_CRIT_THR is the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_CHK_ESCS
parameter.short_desc: Enable checks on ESCs that report telemetry
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is set, the system will check ESC's online status and failures. This param is specific for ESCs reporting status. It shall be used only if ESCs support telemetry.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_HFLT_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Enable FMU SD card hardfault detection check
parameter.long_desc: This check detects if there are hardfault files present on the SD card. If so, and the parameter is enabled, arming is prevented.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_IMU_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Maximum accelerometer inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_IMU_GYR
parameter.short_desc: Maximum rate gyro inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MAG_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum magnetic field inconsistency between units that will allow arming
parameter.long_desc: Set -1 to disable the check.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MAG_STR
parameter.long_desc: Check if the estimator detects a strong magnetic disturbance (check enabled by EKF2_MAG_CHECK)

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MIS_REQ
parameter.long_desc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without a valid mission.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_ODID
parameter.short_desc: Enable Drone ID system detection and health check
parameter.long_desc: This check detects if the Open Drone ID system is missing. Depending on the value of the parameter, the check can be disabled, warn only or deny arming.

values.value: Enforce Open Drone ID system presence

parameter.name: COM_ARM_SDCARD
parameter.short_desc: Enable FMU SD card detection check
parameter.long_desc: This check detects if the FMU SD card is missing. Depending on the value of the parameter, the check can be disabled, warn only or deny arming.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_SWISBTN
parameter.short_desc: Arm switch is a momentary button
parameter.long_desc: 0: Arming/disarming triggers on switch transition. 1: Arming/disarming triggers when holding the momentary button down for COM_RC_ARM_HYST like the stick gesture.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_WO_GPS
parameter.long_desc: Measures taken when a check defined by EKF2_GPS_CHECK is failing.

parameter.name: COM_CPU_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed CPU load to still arm
parameter.long_desc: The check fails if the CPU load is above this threshold for 2s. A negative value disables the check.

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_LAND
parameter.short_desc: Time-out for auto disarm after landing
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time-out period in seconds after which the vehicle will be automatically disarmed in case a landing situation has been detected during this period. A zero or negative value means that automatic disarming triggered by landing detection is disabled.

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_MAN
parameter.short_desc: Allow disarming via switch/stick/button on multicopters in manual thrust modes
parameter.long_desc: 0: Disallow disarming when not landed 1: Allow disarming in multicopter flight in modes where the thrust is directly controlled by thr throttle stick e.g. Stabilized, Acro

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_PRFLT
parameter.short_desc: Time-out for auto disarm if not taking off
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time in seconds, within which the vehicle is expected to take off after arming. In case the vehicle didn't takeoff within the timeout it disarms again. A negative value disables autmoatic disarming triggered by a pre-takeoff timeout.

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink, the GCS connection lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_FAIL_ACT_T
parameter.short_desc: Delay between failsafe condition triggered and failsafe reaction
parameter.long_desc: Before entering failsafe (RTL, Land, Hold), wait COM_FAIL_ACT_T seconds in Hold mode for the user to realize. During that time the user cannot take over control via the stick override feature (see COM_RC_OVERRIDE). Afterwards the configured failsafe action is triggered and the user may use stick override. A zero value disables the delay and the user cannot take over via stick movements (switching modes is still allowed).

parameter.name: COM_FLIGHT_UUID
parameter.long_desc: This number is incremented automatically after every flight on disarming in order to remember the next flight UUID. The first flight is 0.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE1
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE2
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE3
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE4
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE5
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE6
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTT_LOW_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes when the remaining flight time is below the estimated time it takes to reach the RTL destination.

parameter.name: COM_FLT_PROFILE
parameter.long_desc: Describes the intended use of the vehicle. Can be used by ground control software or log post processing. This param does not influence the behavior within the firmware. This means for example the control logic is independent of the setting of this param (but depends on other params).

parameter.name: COM_FLT_TIME_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The vehicle aborts the current operation and returns to launch when the time since takeoff is above this value. It is not possible to resume the mission or switch to any auto mode other than RTL or Land. Taking over in any manual mode is still possible. Starting from 90% of the maximum flight time, a warning message will be sent every 1 minute with the remaining time until automatic RTL. Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: COM_FORCE_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Force safety when the vehicle disarms

parameter.name: COM_HLDL_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: High Latency Datalink loss time threshold
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_HLDL_REG_T
parameter.short_desc: High Latency Datalink regain time threshold
parameter.long_desc: After a data link loss: after this number of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameter.name: COM_HOME_EN
parameter.long_desc: Set home position automatically if possible.

parameter.name: COM_HOME_IN_AIR
parameter.short_desc: Allows setting the home position after takeoff
parameter.long_desc: If set to true, the autopilot is allowed to set its home position after takeoff The true home position is back-computed if a local position is estimate if available. If no local position is available, home is set to the current position.

parameter.name: COM_IMB_PROP_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes when an imbalanced propeller is detected by the failure detector. See also FD_IMB_PROP_THR to set the failure threshold.

parameter.name: COM_KILL_DISARM
parameter.short_desc: Timeout value for disarming when kill switch is engaged

parameter.name: COM_LKDOWN_TKO
parameter.short_desc: Timeout for detecting a failure after takeoff
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the timeframe in seconds within failure detector is allowed to disarm the vehicle if attitude exceeds the limits defined in FD_FAIL_P and FD_FAIL_R. The check is not executed for flight modes that do support acrobatic maneuvers, e.g: Acro (MC/FW) and Manual (FW). A zero or negative value means that the check is disabled.

parameter.name: COM_LOW_BAT_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes at critical battery. See also BAT_CRIT_THR and BAT_EMERGEN_THR for definition of battery states.

values.value: Return at critical level, land at emergency level

parameter.name: COM_MODE0_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE1_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE2_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE3_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE4_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE5_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE6_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MODE7_HASH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is automatically set to identify external modes. It ensures that modes get assigned to the same index independent from their startup order, which is required when mapping an external mode to an RC switch.

parameter.name: COM_MOT_TEST_EN
parameter.long_desc: If set, enables the actuator test interface via MAVLink (ACTUATOR_TEST), that allows spinning the motors and moving the servos for testing purposes.

parameter.name: COM_OBC_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: Time-out to wait when onboard computer connection is lost before warning about loss connection

parameter.name: COM_OBL_RC_ACT
parameter.long_desc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameter.name: COM_OF_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: Time-out to wait when offboard connection is lost before triggering offboard lost action
parameter.long_desc: See COM_OBL_RC_ACT to configure action.

parameter.name: COM_PARACHUTE
parameter.short_desc: Expect and require a healthy MAVLink parachute system

parameter.name: COM_POSCTL_NAVL
parameter.long_desc: This sets the flight mode that will be used if navigation accuracy is no longer adequate for position control in manual Position mode.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_EPH
parameter.long_desc: This is the horizontal position error (EPH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing. If the previous position error was below this threshold, there is an additional factor of 2.5 applied (threshold for invalidation 2.5 times the one for validation). Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: COM_POS_LOW_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes when the estimated position has an accuracy below the specified threshold. See COM_POS_LOW_EPH to set the failsafe threshold. The failsafe action is only executed if the vehicle is in auto mission or auto loiter mode, otherwise it is only a warning.

parameter.name: COM_POS_LOW_EPH
parameter.long_desc: This triggers the action specified in COM_POS_LOW_ACT if the estimated position accuracy is below this threshold. Local position has to be still declared valid, which requires some kind of velocity aiding or large dead-reckoning time (EKF2_NOAID_TOUT), and a high failsafe threshold (COM_POS_FS_EPH). Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: COM_POWER_COUNT
parameter.short_desc: Required number of redundant power modules
parameter.long_desc: This configures a check to verify the expected number of 5V rail power supplies are present. By default only one is expected. Note: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK disables all power checks including this one.

parameter.name: COM_PREARM_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Condition to enter the prearmed state, an intermediate state between disarmed and armed in which non-throttling actuators are active.

parameter.name: COM_RAM_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed RAM usage to pass checks
parameter.long_desc: The check fails if the RAM usage is above this threshold. A negative value disables the check.

parameter.name: COM_RCL_EXCEPT
parameter.long_desc: Specify modes in which RC loss is ignored and the failsafe action not triggered.

parameter.name: COM_RC_ARM_HYST
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 1000 requires the stick to be held in the arm or disarm position for 1 second.

parameter.name: COM_RC_IN_MODE
parameter.long_desc: A value of 0 enables RC transmitter control (only). A valid RC transmitter calibration is required. A value of 1 allows joystick control only. RC input handling and the associated checks are disabled. A value of 2 allows either RC Transmitter or Joystick input. The first valid input is used, will fallback to other sources if the input stream becomes invalid. A value of 3 allows either input from RC or joystick. The first available source is selected and used until reboot. A value of 4 ignores any stick input.

parameter.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: The time in seconds without a new setpoint from RC or Joystick, after which the connection is considered lost. This must be kept short as the vehicle will use the last supplied setpoint until the timeout triggers.

parameter.name: COM_RC_OVERRIDE
parameter.short_desc: Enable RC stick override of auto and/or offboard modes
parameter.long_desc: When RC stick override is enabled, moving the RC sticks more than COM_RC_STICK_OV immediately gives control back to the pilot by switching to Position mode and if position is unavailable Altitude mode. Note: Only has an effect on multicopters, and VTOLs in multicopter mode.

bitmask.bit: Enable override during auto modes (except for in critical battery reaction)

parameter.name: COM_RC_STICK_OV
parameter.long_desc: If COM_RC_OVERRIDE is enabled and the joystick input is moved more than this threshold the autopilot the pilot takes over control.

parameter.name: COM_SPOOLUP_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Enforced delay between arming and further navigation
parameter.long_desc: The minimal time from arming the motors until moving the vehicle is possible is COM_SPOOLUP_TIME seconds. Goal: - Motors and propellers spool up to idle speed before getting commanded to spin faster - Timeout for ESCs and smart batteries to successfulyy do failure checks e.g. for stuck rotors before the vehicle is off the ground

parameter.name: COM_TAKEOFF_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Action after TAKEOFF has been accepted
parameter.long_desc: The mode transition after TAKEOFF has completed successfully.

parameter.name: COM_THROW_EN
parameter.long_desc: Allows to start the vehicle by throwing it into the air.

parameter.name: COM_THROW_SPEED
parameter.short_desc: Minimum speed for the throw start
parameter.long_desc: When the throw launch is enabled, the drone will only allow motors to spin after this speed is exceeded before detecting the freefall. This is a safety feature to ensure the drone does not turn on after accidental drop or a rapid movement before the throw. Set to 0 to disable.

parameter.name: COM_VEL_FS_EVH
parameter.long_desc: This is the horizontal velocity error (EVH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing. If the previous velocity error was below this threshold, there is an additional factor of 2.5 applied (threshold for invalidation 2.5 times the one for validation).

parameter.name: COM_WIND_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Wind speed threshold above which an automatic failsafe action is triggered. Failsafe action can be specified with COM_WIND_MAX_ACT.

parameter.name: COM_WIND_MAX_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes when a wind speed above the specified threshold is detected. See COM_WIND_MAX to set the failsafe threshold. If enabled, it is not possible to resume the mission or switch to any auto mode other than RTL or Land if this threshold is exceeded. Taking over in any manual mode is still possible.

parameter.name: COM_WIND_WARN
parameter.long_desc: A warning is triggered if the currently estimated wind speed is above this value. Warning is sent periodically (every 1 minute). Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Set GCS connection loss failsafe mode
parameter.long_desc: The GCS connection loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_DL_LOSS_T in seconds. Once the timeout occurs the selected action will be executed.

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_ACT
parameter.long_desc: The RC loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_RC_LOSS_T in seconds. If RC input checks have been disabled by setting the COM_RC_IN_MODE param it will not be triggered.

parameter.name: CYPHAL_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: 0 - Cyphal disabled. 1 - Enables Cyphal

parameter.name: CYPHAL_ID
parameter.long_desc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.

parameter.name: UCAN1_ACTR_PUB
parameter.short_desc: actuator_outputs uORB over Cyphal publication port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_BMS_BP_SUB
parameter.short_desc: UDRAL battery parameters subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_BMS_BS_SUB
parameter.short_desc: UDRAL battery status subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_BMS_ES_SUB
parameter.short_desc: UDRAL battery energy source subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB0_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 0 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB1_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 1 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB2_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 2 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB3_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 3 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB4_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 4 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB5_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 5 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB6_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 6 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_FB7_SUB
parameter.short_desc: Cyphal ESC 7 zubax feedback port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_UORB_GPS
parameter.short_desc: sensor_gps uORB over Cyphal subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_UORB_GPS_P
parameter.short_desc: sensor_gps uORB over Cyphal publication port ID

parameter.name: DSHOT_3D_DEAD_H
parameter.long_desc: When the actuator_output is between DSHOT_3D_DEAD_L and DSHOT_3D_DEAD_H, motor will not spin. This value is with respect to the mixer_module range (0-1999), not the DSHOT values.

parameter.name: DSHOT_3D_DEAD_L
parameter.long_desc: When the actuator_output is between DSHOT_3D_DEAD_L and DSHOT_3D_DEAD_H, motor will not spin. This value is with respect to the mixer_module range (0-1999), not the DSHOT values.

parameter.name: DSHOT_3D_ENABLE
parameter.short_desc: Allows for 3d mode when using DShot and suitable mixer
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: ESC must be configured for 3D mode, and DSHOT_MIN set to 0. This splits the throttle ranges in two. Direction 1) 48 is the slowest, 1047 is the fastest. Direction 2) 1049 is the slowest, 2047 is the fastest. When mixer outputs 1000 or value inside DSHOT 3D deadband, DShot 0 is sent.

parameter.name: DSHOT_BIDIR_EN
parameter.long_desc: This parameter enables bidirectional DShot which provides RPM feedback. Note that this requires ESCs that support bidirectional DSHot, e.g. BlHeli32. This is not the same as DShot telemetry which requires an additional serial connection.

parameter.name: DSHOT_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum Output Value for DShot in percent. The value depends on the ESC. Make sure to set this high enough so that the motors are always spinning while armed.

parameter.name: DSHOT_TEL_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run DShot Driver.

parameter.name: MOT_POLE_COUNT
parameter.short_desc: Number of magnetic poles of the motors
parameter.long_desc: Specify the number of magnetic poles of the motors. It is required to compute the RPM value from the eRPM returned with the ESC telemetry. Either get the number from the motor spec sheet or count the magnets on the bell of the motor (not the stator magnets). Typical motors for 5 inch props have 14 poles.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_ACCLIM
parameter.short_desc: Maximum IMU accel magnitude that allows IMU bias learning
parameter.long_desc: If the magnitude of the IMU accelerometer vector exceeds this value, the EKF accel bias state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of high manoeuvre accelerations and IMU nonlinerity and scale factor errors on the accel bias estimates.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_GYRLIM
parameter.short_desc: Maximum IMU gyro angular rate magnitude that allows IMU bias learning
parameter.long_desc: If the magnitude of the IMU angular rate vector exceeds this value, the EKF accel bias state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of rapid rotation rates and associated errors on the accel bias estimates.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The ekf accel bias states will be limited to within a range equivalent to +- of this value.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_TAU
parameter.short_desc: Accel bias learning inhibit time constant
parameter.long_desc: The vector magnitude of angular rate and acceleration used to check if learning should be inhibited has a peak hold filter applied to it with an exponential decay. This parameter controls the time constant of the decay.

parameter.name: EKF2_ACC_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for IMU accelerometer bias prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_AGP_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Horizontal position fusion 1 : Vertical position fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_AGP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Aux global position estimator delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_AGP_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for aux global position fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_AGP_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for aux global position measurements
parameter.long_desc: Used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_ANGERR_INIT
parameter.short_desc: 1-sigma tilt angle uncertainty after gravity vector alignment

parameter.name: EKF2_ARSP_THR
parameter.long_desc: Airspeed data is fused for wind estimation if above this threshold. Set to 0 to disable airspeed fusion. For reliable wind estimation both sideslip (see EKF2_FUSE_BETA) and airspeed fusion should be enabled. Only applies to fixed-wing vehicles (or VTOLs in fixed-wing mode).

parameter.name: EKF2_ASPD_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum airspeed used for baro static pressure compensation

parameter.name: EKF2_ASP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_AVEL_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary Velocity Estimate delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the barometric height measurements to estimate its height in addition to other height sources (if activated).

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Barometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for barometric and GPS height fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_BCOEF_X
parameter.short_desc: X-axis ballistic coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by bluff body drag along the forward/reverse axis when flying a multi-copter which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_DRAG_CTRL parameter. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EKF2_MCOEF parameter. Set this parameter to zero to turn off the bluff body drag model for this axis.

parameter.name: EKF2_BCOEF_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y-axis ballistic coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by bluff body drag along the right/left axis when flying a multi-copter, which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_DRAG_CTRL parameter. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EKF2_MCOEF parameter. Set this parameter to zero to turn off the bluff body drag model for this axis.

parameter.name: EKF2_BETA_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for synthetic sideslip fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_DECL_TYPE
parameter.short_desc: Integer bitmask controlling handling of magnetic declination
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable functions. 0 : Set to true to use the declination from the geo_lookup library when the GPS position becomes available, set to false to always use the EKF2_MAG_DECL value. 1 : Set to true to save the EKF2_MAG_DECL parameter to the value returned by the EKF when the vehicle disarms.

parameter.name: EKF2_DELAY_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum delay of all the aiding sensors
parameter.long_desc: Defines the delay between the current time and the delayed-time horizon. This value should be at least as large as the largest EKF2_XXX_DELAY parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_DRAG_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: Activate wind speed estimation using specific-force measurements and a drag model defined by EKF2_BCOEF_[XY] and EKF2_MCOEF. Only use on vehicles that have their thrust aligned with the Z axis and no thrust in the XY plane.

parameter.name: EKF2_DRAG_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Specific drag force observation noise variance
parameter.long_desc: Used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model. Increasing this makes the multi-rotor wind estimates adjust more slowly.

parameter.name: EKF2_EVA_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision angle measurements
parameter.long_desc: Used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_EVP_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for vision position fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_EVP_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision position measurements
parameter.long_desc: Used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_EVV_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for vision velocity estimate fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_EVV_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision velocity measurements
parameter.long_desc: Used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Horizontal position fusion 1 : Vertical position fusion 2 : 3D velocity fusion 3 : Yaw

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Vision Position Estimator delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_NOISE_MD
parameter.long_desc: If set to 0 (default) the measurement noise is taken from the vision message and the EV noise parameters are used as a lower bound. If set to 1 the observation noise is set from the parameters directly,

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of VI sensor focal point in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of VI sensor focal point in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of VI sensor focal point in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_QMIN
parameter.long_desc: External vision will only be started and fused if the quality metric is above this threshold. The quality metric is a completely optional field provided by some VIO systems.

parameter.name: EKF2_FUSE_BETA
parameter.long_desc: For reliable wind estimation both sideslip and airspeed fusion (see EKF2_ARSP_THR) should be enabled. Only applies to fixed-wing vehicles (or VTOLs in fixed-wing mode). Note: side slip fusion is currently not supported for tailsitters.

parameter.name: EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Baro deadzone range for height fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the value of deadzone applied to negative baro innovations. Deadzone is enabled when EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ > 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_GND_MAX_HGT
parameter.short_desc: Height above ground level for ground effect zone
parameter.long_desc: Sets the maximum distance to the ground level where negative baro innovations are expected.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_CHECK
parameter.long_desc: Each threshold value is defined by the parameter indicated next to the check. Drift and offset checks only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Longitude and latitude fusion 1 : Altitude fusion 2 : 3D velocity fusion 3 : Dual antenna heading fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: GPS measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of GPS antenna in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of GPS antenna in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of GPS antenna in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_P_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for GNSS position fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_V_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for GNSS velocity fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_YAW_OFF
parameter.short_desc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_GRAV_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Accelerometer measurement noise for gravity based observations

parameter.name: EKF2_GSF_TAS
parameter.short_desc: Default value of true airspeed used in EKF-GSF AHRS calculation
parameter.long_desc: If no airspeed measurements are available, the EKF-GSF AHRS calculation will assume this value of true airspeed when compensating for centripetal acceleration during turns. Set to zero to disable centripetal acceleration compensation during fixed wing flight modes.

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_B_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The ekf gyro bias states will be limited to within a range equivalent to +- of this value.

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for IMU rate gyro bias prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Rate gyro noise for covariance prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_HDG_GATE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_HEAD_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for magnetic heading fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_HGT_REF
parameter.short_desc: Determines the reference source of height data used by the EKF
parameter.long_desc: When multiple height sources are enabled at the same time, the height estimate will always converge towards the reference height source selected by this parameter. The range sensor and vision options should only be used when for operation over a flat surface as the local NED origin will move up and down with ground level. If GPS is set as reference but altitude fusion is disabled in EKF2_GPS_CTRL, the GPS altitude is still used to initiaize the bias of the other height sensors.

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of IMU in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of IMU in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of IMU in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_ACCLIM
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal acceleration threshold used for heading observability check
parameter.long_desc: The heading is assumed to be observable when the body acceleration is greater than this parameter when a global position/velocity aiding source is active.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for body magnetic field prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_CHECK
parameter.long_desc: Bitmask to set which check is used to decide whether the magnetometer data is valid. If GNSS data is received, the magnetic field is compared to a World Magnetic Model (WMM), otherwise an average value is used. This check is useful to reject occasional hard iron disturbance. Set bits to 1 to enable checks. Checks enabled by the following bit positions 0 : Magnetic field strength. Set tolerance using EKF2_MAG_CHK_STR 1 : Magnetic field inclination. Set tolerance using EKF2_MAG_CHK_INC 2 : Wait for GNSS to find the theoretical strength and inclination using the WMM

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_CHK_INC
parameter.long_desc: Maximum allowed deviation from the expected magnetic field inclination to pass the check.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_CHK_STR
parameter.long_desc: Maximum allowed deviation from the expected magnetic field strength to pass the check.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_E_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for earth magnetic field prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for magnetometer XYZ component fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Integer controlling the type of magnetometer fusion used - magnetic heading or 3-component vector. The fusion of magnetometer data as a three component vector enables vehicle body fixed hard iron errors to be learned, but requires a stable earth field. If set to 'Automatic' magnetic heading fusion is used when on-ground and 3-axis magnetic field fusion in-flight. If set to 'Magnetic heading' magnetic heading fusion is used at all times. If set to 'None' the magnetometer will not be used under any circumstance. If no external source of yaw is available, it is possible to use post-takeoff horizontal movement combined with GNSS velocity measurements to align the yaw angle. If set to 'Init' the magnetometer is only used to initalize the heading.

parameter.name: EKF2_MCOEF
parameter.short_desc: Propeller momentum drag coefficient for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by the propellers when flying a multi-copter, which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_DRAG_CTRL parameter. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed not speed squared and is produced because some of the air velocity normal to the propeller axis of rotation is lost when passing through the rotor disc. This changes the momentum of the flow which creates a drag reaction force. When comparing un-ducted propellers of the same diameter, the effect is roughly proportional to the area of the propeller blades when viewed side on and changes with propeller selection. Momentum drag is significantly higher for ducted rotors. To account for the drag produced by the body which scales with speed squared, see documentation for the EKF2_BCOEF_X and EKF2_BCOEF_Y parameters. Set this parameter to zero to turn off the momentum drag model for both axis.

parameter.name: EKF2_MIN_RNG
parameter.short_desc: Expected range finder reading when on ground
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle is on ground, is not moving as determined by the motion test and the range finder is returning invalid or no data, then an assumed range value of EKF2_MIN_RNG will be used by the terrain estimator so that a terrain height estimate is available at the start of flight in situations where the range finder may be inside its minimum measurements distance when on ground.

parameter.name: EKF2_MULTI_IMU
parameter.long_desc: Maximum number of IMUs to use for Multi-EKF. Set 0 to disable. Requires SENS_IMU_MODE 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_MULTI_MAG
parameter.long_desc: Maximum number of magnetometers to use for Multi-EKF. Set 0 to disable. Requires SENS_MAG_MODE 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_NOAID_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for non-aiding position hold

parameter.name: EKF2_NOAID_TOUT
parameter.long_desc: Maximum lapsed time from last fusion of measurements that constrain velocity drift before the EKF will report the horizontal nav solution as invalid

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: Enable optical flow fusion.

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameter.long_desc: Assumes measurement is timestamped at trailing edge of integration period

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for optical flow fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_GYR_SRC
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow angular rate compensation source
parameter.long_desc: Auto: use gyro from optical flow message if available, internal gyro otherwise. Internal: always use internal gyro

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_N_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor when it's reported quality metric is at the minimum

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_N_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor when it's reported quality metric is at the maximum

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of optical flow focal point in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of optical flow focal point in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of optical flow focal point in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_QMIN
parameter.short_desc: In air optical flow minimum quality
parameter.long_desc: Optical Flow data will only be used in air if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_QMIN_GND
parameter.short_desc: On ground optical flow minimum quality
parameter.long_desc: Optical Flow data will only be used on the ground if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN_GND

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XN
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the negative X axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XP
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the positive X axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forward flight, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YN
parameter.short_desc: Pressure position error coefficient for the negative Y axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the negative Y (LH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YP
parameter.short_desc: Pressure position error coefficient for the positive Y axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the positive Y (RH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the Z axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the Z body axis.

parameter.name: EKF2_PREDICT_US
parameter.long_desc: EKF prediction period in microseconds. This should ideally be an integer multiple of the IMU time delta. Actual filter update will be an integer multiple of IMU update.

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_GPS_H
parameter.short_desc: Required GPS health time on startup
parameter.long_desc: Minimum continuous period without GPS failure required to mark a healthy GPS status. It can be reduced to speed up initialization, but it's recommended to keep this unchanged for a vehicle.

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal drift speed to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_NSATS
parameter.short_desc: Required satellite count to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_SACC
parameter.short_desc: Required speed accuracy to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical drift speed to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum height above ground allowed for conditional range aid mode
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle absolute altitude exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate its height. This only applies when conditional range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_CTRL = 1).

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_IGATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size used for innovation consistency checks for range aid fusion
parameter.long_desc: A lower value means HAGL needs to be more stable in order to use range finder for height estimation in range aid mode

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed for conditional range aid mode
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle horizontal speed exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate its height. This only applies when conditional range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_CTRL = 1).

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_CTRL
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: Range finder measurements are less reliable and can experience unexpected errors. For these reasons, if accurate control of height relative to ground is required, it is recommended to use the MPC_ALT_MODE parameter instead, unless baro errors are severe enough to cause problems with landing and takeoff. If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the range finder measurements to estimate its height in addition to other height sources (if activated). Range sensor aiding can be enabled (i.e.: always use) or set in "conditional" mode. Conditional mode: This enables the range finder to be used during low speed (< EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX) and low altitude (< EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX) operation, eg takeoff and landing, where baro interference from rotor wash is excessive and can corrupt EKF state estimates. It is intended to be used where a vertical takeoff and landing is performed, and horizontal flight does not occur until above EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Range finder measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_FOG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum distance at which the range finder could detect fog (m)
parameter.long_desc: Limit for fog detection. If the range finder measures a distance greater than this value, the measurement is considered to not be blocked by fog or rain. If there's a jump from larger than RNG_FOG to smaller than EKF2_RNG_FOG, the measurement may gets rejected. 0 - disabled

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for range finder fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_K_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size used for range finder kinematic consistency check
parameter.long_desc: To be used, the time derivative of the distance sensor measurements projected on the vertical axis needs to be statistically consistent with the estimated vertical velocity of the drone. Decrease this value to make the filter more robust against range finder faulty data (stuck, reflections, ...). Note: tune the range finder noise parameters (EKF2_RNG_NOISE and EKF2_RNG_SFE) before tuning this gate.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for range finder fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of range finder origin in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of range finder origin in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of range finder origin in body frame
parameter.long_desc: Forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_QLTY_T
parameter.long_desc: Minimum duration during which the reported range finder signal quality needs to be non-zero in order to be declared valid (s)

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_SFE
parameter.short_desc: Range finder range dependent noise scaler
parameter.long_desc: Specifies the increase in range finder noise with range.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_ERR_RED
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 instances have to be better than the selected by at least this amount before their relative score can be reduced.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_ACC
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector acceleration error threshold for comparing accelerometers. Acceleration vector differences larger than this will result in accumulated velocity error.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_ANG
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector maximum accumulated angular error threshold for comparing gyros. Accumulated angular error larger than this will result in the sensor being declared faulty.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_RAT
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector angular rate error threshold for comparing gyros. Angular rate vector differences larger than this will result in accumulated angular error.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_VEL
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector maximum accumulated velocity threshold for comparing accelerometers. Accumulated velocity error larger than this will result in the sensor being declared faulty.

parameter.name: EKF2_SYNT_MAG_Z
parameter.short_desc: Enable synthetic magnetometer Z component measurement
parameter.long_desc: Use for vehicles where the measured body Z magnetic field is subject to strong magnetic interference. For magnetic heading fusion the magnetometer Z measurement will be replaced by a synthetic value calculated using the knowledge of the 3D magnetic field vector at the location of the drone. Therefore, this parameter will only have an effect if the global position of the drone is known. For 3D mag fusion the magnetometer Z measurement will simply be ignored instead of fusing the synthetic value.

parameter.name: EKF2_TAS_GATE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_TAU_POS
parameter.long_desc: Controls how tightly the output track the EKF states

parameter.name: EKF2_TAU_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Time constant of the velocity output prediction and smoothing filter

parameter.name: EKF2_WIND_NSD
parameter.short_desc: Process noise spectral density for wind velocity prediction
parameter.long_desc: When unaided, the wind estimate uncertainty (1-sigma, in m/s) increases by this amount every second.

parameter.name: EV_TSK_RC_LOSS
parameter.long_desc: Enable/disable event task for RC Loss. When enabled, an alarm tune will be played via buzzer or ESCs, if supported. The alarm will sound after a disarm, if the vehicle was previously armed and only if the vehicle had RC signal at some point. Particularly useful for locating crashed drones without a GPS sensor.

parameter.name: EV_TSK_STAT_DIS
parameter.long_desc: Enable/disable event task for displaying the vehicle status using arm-mounted LEDs. When enabled and if the vehicle supports it, LEDs will flash indicating various vehicle status changes. Currently PX4 has not implemented any specific status events. -

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Applies to both directions in all manual modes with attitude stabilization but without altitude control

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Applies to both directions in all manual modes with attitude stabilization

parameter.name: FW_MAN_YR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximally added yaw rate setpoint from the yaw stick in any attitude controlled flight mode. It is added to the yaw rate setpoint generated by the controller for turn coordination.

parameter.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameter.short_desc: Pitch setpoint offset (pitch at level flight)
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the pitch at typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum negative / down pitch rate setpoint

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
