parameter.short_desc: Maximum positive / up pitch rate setpoint

parameter.name: FW_P_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a pitch step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Smaller systems may require smaller values.

parameter.name: FW_R_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a roll step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Smaller systems may require smaller values.

parameter.name: FW_WR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_WR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the wheel steering input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_W_EN
parameter.long_desc: Only enabled during automatic runway takeoff and landing. In all manual modes the wheel is directly controlled with yaw stick.

parameter.name: FW_W_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum wheel steering rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_LND_ABORT
parameter.short_desc: Bit mask to set the automatic landing abort conditions
parameter.long_desc: Terrain estimation: bit 0: Abort if terrain is not found bit 1: Abort if terrain times out (after a first successful measurement) The last estimate is always used as ground, whether the last valid measurement or the land waypoint, depending on the selected abort criteria, until an abort condition is entered. If FW_LND_USETER == 0, these bits are ignored. TODO: Extend automatic abort conditions e.g. glide slope tracking error (horizontal and vertical)

bitmask.bit: Abort if terrain is not found (only applies to mission landings)
Abort if terrain times out (after a first successful measurement)

parameter.name: FW_LND_AIRSPD
parameter.long_desc: The calibrated airspeed setpoint during landing. If set <= 0, landing airspeed = FW_AIRSPD_MIN by default.

parameter.name: FW_LND_ANG
parameter.long_desc: Typically the desired landing slope angle when landing configuration (flaps, airspeed) is enabled. Set this value within the vehicle's performance limits.

parameter.name: FW_LND_EARLYCFG
parameter.long_desc: Allows to deploy the landing configuration (flaps, landing airspeed, etc.) already in the loiter-down waypoint before the final approach. Otherwise is enabled only in the final approach.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)
parameter.long_desc: NOTE: max(FW_LND_FLALT, FW_LND_FL_TIME * |z-velocity|) is taken as the flare altitude

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_PMAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch during landing flare.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_PMIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum pitch during landing flare.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_SINK
parameter.long_desc: TECS will attempt to control the aircraft to this sink rate via pitch angle (throttle killed during flare)

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Multiplied by the descent rate to calculate a dynamic altitude at which to trigger the flare. NOTE: max(FW_LND_FLALT, FW_LND_FL_TIME * descent rate) is taken as the flare altitude

parameter.name: FW_LND_NUDGE
parameter.long_desc: Approach angle nudging: shifts the touchdown point laterally while keeping the approach entrance point constant Approach path nudging: shifts the touchdown point laterally along with the entire approach path This is useful for manually adjusting the landing point in real time when map or GNSS errors cause an offset from the desired landing vector. Nudging is done with yaw stick, constrained to FW_LND_TD_OFF (in meters) and the direction is relative to the vehicle heading (stick deflection to the right = land point moves to the right as seen by the vehicle).

parameter.name: FW_LND_TD_OFF
parameter.short_desc: Maximum lateral position offset for the touchdown point

parameter.name: FW_LND_TD_TIME
parameter.long_desc: This is the time after the start of flaring that we expect the vehicle to touch the runway. At this time, a 0.5s clamp down ramp will engage, constraining the pitch setpoint to RWTO_PSP. If enabled, ensure that RWTO_PSP is configured appropriately for full gear contact on ground roll. Set to -1.0 to disable touchdown clamping. E.g. it may not be desirable to clamp on belly landings. The touchdown time will be constrained to be greater than or equal to the flare time (FW_LND_FL_TIME).

parameter.name: FW_LND_THRTC_SC
parameter.short_desc: Altitude time constant factor for landing and low-height flight
parameter.long_desc: The TECS altitude time constant (FW_T_ALT_TC) is multiplied by this value.

parameter.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameter.long_desc: This is critical for detecting when to flare, and should be enabled if possible. If enabled and no measurement is found within a given timeout, the landing waypoint altitude will be used OR the landing will be aborted, depending on the criteria set in FW_LND_ABORT. If disabled, FW_LND_ABORT terrain based criteria are ignored.

values.value: Use the terrain estimate to trigger the flare (only)
Calculate landing glide slope relative to the terrain estimate

parameter.name: FW_WING_HEIGHT
parameter.short_desc: Height (AGL) of the wings when the aircraft is on the ground
parameter.long_desc: This is used to constrain a minimum altitude below which we keep wings level to avoid wing tip strike. It's safer to give a slight margin here (> 0m)

parameter.name: FW_WING_SPAN
parameter.short_desc: The aircraft's wing span (length from tip to tip)
parameter.long_desc: This is used for limiting the roll setpoint near the ground. (if multiple wings, take the longest span)

parameter.name: FW_LAUN_AC_T
parameter.long_desc: Launch is detected when acceleration in body forward direction is above FW_LAUN_AC_THLD for FW_LAUN_AC_T seconds.

parameter.name: FW_LAUN_AC_THLD
parameter.long_desc: Launch is detected when acceleration in body forward direction is above FW_LAUN_AC_THLD for FW_LAUN_AC_T seconds.

parameter.name: FW_LAUN_DETCN_ON
parameter.long_desc: Enables automatic launch detection based on measured acceleration. Use for hand- or catapult-launched vehicles. Not compatible with runway takeoff.

parameter.name: FW_LAUN_MOT_DEL
parameter.long_desc: Start the motor(s) this amount of seconds after launch is detected.

parameter.name: NPFG_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping ratio of NPFG control law.

parameter.name: NPFG_EN_MIN_GSP
parameter.short_desc: Enable minimum forward ground speed maintaining excess wind handling logic

parameter.name: NPFG_GSP_MAX_TK
parameter.short_desc: Maximum, minimum forward ground speed for track keeping in excess wind
parameter.long_desc: The maximum value of the minimum forward ground speed that may be commanded by the track keeping excess wind handling logic. Commanded in full at the normalized track error fraction of the track error boundary and reduced to zero on track.

parameter.name: NPFG_LB_PERIOD
parameter.short_desc: Enable automatic lower bound on the NPFG period
parameter.long_desc: Avoids limit cycling from a too aggressively tuned period/damping combination. If false, also disables upper bound NPFG_PERIOD_UB.

parameter.name: NPFG_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: Period of NPFG control law.

parameter.name: NPFG_PERIOD_SF
parameter.long_desc: Multiplied by period for conservative minimum period bounding (when period lower bounding is enabled). 1.0 bounds at marginal stability.

parameter.name: NPFG_ROLL_TC
parameter.long_desc: Time constant of roll controller command / response, modeled as first order delay. Used to determine lower period bound. Setting zero disables automatic period bounding.

parameter.name: NPFG_SW_DST_MLT
parameter.long_desc: Multiplied by the track error boundary to determine when the aircraft switches to the next waypoint and/or path segment. Should be less than 1.

parameter.name: NPFG_TRACK_KEEP
parameter.short_desc: Enable track keeping excess wind handling logic

parameter.name: NPFG_UB_PERIOD
parameter.short_desc: Enable automatic upper bound on the NPFG period
parameter.long_desc: Adapts period to maintain track keeping in variable winds and path curvature.

parameter.name: NPFG_WIND_REG
parameter.long_desc: Disabling this parameter further disables all other airspeed incrementation options.

parameter.name: FW_PN_R_SLEW_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Path navigation roll slew rate limit
parameter.long_desc: Maximum change in roll angle setpoint per second. Applied in all Auto modes, plus manual Position & Altitude modes.

parameter.name: FW_POS_STK_CONF
parameter.long_desc: Applies in manual Position and Altitude flight modes.

bitmask.bit: Alternative stick configuration (height rate on throttle stick, airspeed on pitch stick)
Enable airspeed setpoint via sticks in altitude and position flight mode

parameter.name: FW_R_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Applies in any altitude controlled flight mode.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command. Further, if the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively. Has to be set according to the vehicle's stall speed (which should be set in FW_AIRSPD_STALL), with some margin between the stall speed and minimum airspeed. This value corresponds to the desired minimum speed with the default load factor (level flight, default weight), and is automatically adpated to the current load factor (calculated from roll setpoint and WEIGHT_GROSS/WEIGHT_BASE).

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_STALL
parameter.long_desc: The stall airspeed (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. It is used for airspeed sensor failure detection and for the control surface scaling airspeed limits.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: The trim CAS (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. If an airspeed controller is active, this is the default airspeed setpoint that the controller will try to achieve. This value corresponds to the trim airspeed with the default load factor (level flight, default weight).

parameter.name: FW_SERVICE_CEIL
parameter.long_desc: Altitude in standard atmosphere at which the vehicle in normal configuration (WEIGHT_BASE) is still able to achieve a maximum climb rate of 0.5m/s at maximum throttle (FW_THR_MAX). Used to compensate for air density in FW_T_CLMB_MAX. Set negative to disable.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ASPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle (at sea level, standard atmosphere) for level flight at maximum airspeed FW_AIRSPD_MAX Set to 0 to disable mapping of airspeed to trim throttle.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ASPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle (at sea level, standard atmosphere) for level flight at minimum airspeed FW_AIRSPD_MIN Set to 0 to disable mapping of airspeed to trim throttle below FW_AIRSPD_TRIM.

parameter.name: FW_THR_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle (at sea level, standard atmosphere) for level flight at FW_AIRSPD_TRIM

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum calibrated climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to FW_THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the trim value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum calibrated sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: WEIGHT_BASE
parameter.long_desc: This is the weight of the vehicle at which it's performance limits were derived. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameter.name: WEIGHT_GROSS
parameter.long_desc: This is the actual weight of the vehicle at any time. This value will differ from WEIGHT_BASE in case weight was added or removed from the base weight. Examples are the addition of payloads or larger batteries. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_X_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Acro body roll max rate setpoint

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_YAW_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable yaw rate controller in Acro
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is set to 1, the yaw rate controller is enabled in Fixed-wing Acro mode. Otherwise the pilot commands directly the yaw actuator. It is disabled by default because an active yaw rate controller will fight against the natural turn coordination of the plane.

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Acro body pitch max rate setpoint

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_Z_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Acro body yaw max rate setpoint

parameter.name: FW_ARSP_SCALE_EN
parameter.long_desc: This enables a logic that automatically adjusts the output of the rate controller to take into account the real torque produced by an aerodynamic control surface given the current deviation from the trim airspeed (FW_AIRSPD_TRIM). Enable when using aerodynamic control surfaces (e.g.: plane) Disable when using rotor wings (e.g.: autogyro)

parameter.name: FW_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable throttle scale by battery level
parameter.long_desc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Yaw trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Yaw trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_FLAPS_LND_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Sets a fraction of full flaps during landing. Also applies to flaperons if enabled in the mixer/allocation.

parameter.name: FW_FLAPS_TO_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Sets a fraction of full flaps during take-off. Also applies to flaperons if enabled in the mixer/allocation.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired pitch actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired roll actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_Y_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired yaw actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_PR_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain.

parameter.name: FW_PR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_RLL_TO_YAW_FF
parameter.short_desc: Roll control to yaw control feedforward gain
parameter.long_desc: This gain can be used to counteract the "adverse yaw" effect for fixed wings. When the plane enters a roll it will tend to yaw the nose out of the turn. This gain enables the use of a yaw actuator to counteract this effect.

parameter.name: FW_RR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output.

parameter.name: FW_SPOILERS_MAN
parameter.long_desc: Chose source for manual setting of spoilers in manual flight modes.

parameter.name: FW_USE_AIRSPD
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1, the airspeed measurement data, if valid, is used in the following controllers: - Rate controller: output scaling - Attitude controller: coordinated turn controller - Position controller: airspeed setpoint tracking, takeoff logic - VTOL: transition logic

parameter.name: FW_YR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_GND_SPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The controller will increase the commanded airspeed to maintain this minimum groundspeed to the next waypoint.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Applies in any altitude controlled flight mode.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Applies in any altitude controlled flight mode.

parameter.name: FW_THR_IDLE
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground ("landed") in auto modes.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Applies in any altitude controlled flight mode. Should be set accordingly to achieve FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Applies in any altitude controlled flight mode. Usually set to 0 but can be increased to prevent the motor from stopping when descending, which can increase achievable descent rates.

parameter.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameter.name: FW_TKO_AIRSPD
parameter.long_desc: The calibrated airspeed setpoint during the takeoff climbout. If set <= 0, FW_AIRSPD_MIN will be set by default.

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_R_SP
parameter.long_desc: In auto modes: default climb rate output by controller to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes: maximum climb rate setpoint.

parameter.name: FW_T_F_ALT_ERR
parameter.long_desc: Minimum altitude error needed to descend with max airspeed and minimal throttle. A negative value disables fast descend.

parameter.name: FW_T_I_GAIN_PIT
parameter.long_desc: Increase it to trim out speed and height offsets faster, with the downside of possible overshoots and oscillations.

parameter.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameter.long_desc: Is used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns.

parameter.name: FW_T_SEB_R_FF
parameter.short_desc: Specific total energy balance rate feedforward gain

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_R_SP
parameter.long_desc: In auto modes: default sink rate output by controller to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes: maximum sink rate setpoint.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameter.long_desc: Adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. 0 -> control height only 2 -> control speed only (gliders)

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_DEV_STD
parameter.long_desc: For the airspeed filter in TECS.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_PRC_STD
parameter.short_desc: Process noise standard deviation for the airspeed rate
parameter.long_desc: This is defining the noise in the airspeed rate for the constant airspeed rate model of the TECS airspeed filter.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_STD
parameter.long_desc: For the airspeed filter in TECS.

parameter.name: FW_T_STE_R_TC
parameter.short_desc: Specific total energy rate first order filter time constant
parameter.long_desc: This filter is applied to the specific total energy rate used for throttle damping.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_INTEG
parameter.long_desc: Increase it to trim out speed and height offsets faster, with the downside of possible overshoots and oscillations.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_LOW_HGT
parameter.short_desc: Low-height threshold for tighter altitude tracking
parameter.long_desc: Height above ground threshold below which tighter altitude tracking gets enabled (see FW_LND_THRTC_SC). Below this height, TECS smoothly (1 sec / sec) transitions the altitude tracking time constant from FW_T_ALT_TC to FW_LND_THRTC_SC*FW_T_ALT_TC. -1 to disable.

parameter.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors.

parameter.name: FW_WIND_ARSP_SC
parameter.long_desc: Multiplying this factor with the current absolute wind estimate gives the airspeed offset added to the minimum airspeed setpoint limit. This helps to make the system more robust against disturbances (turbulence) in high wind.

parameter.name: FD_ACT_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that for motors, a minimum amount of ESC current per throttle level is being consumed. Otherwise this indicates an motor failure.

parameter.name: FD_ACT_MOT_C2T
parameter.long_desc: Motor failure triggers only below this current value

parameter.name: FD_ACT_MOT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Motor failure triggers only above this throttle value.

parameter.name: FD_ACT_MOT_TOUT
parameter.long_desc: Motor failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time.

parameter.name: FD_ESCS_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable checks on ESCs that report their arming state
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the ESCs have successfully armed when the vehicle has transitioned to the armed state. Timeout for receiving an acknowledgement from the ESCs is 0.3s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle.

parameter.name: FD_EXT_ATS_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable PWM input on for engaging failsafe from an external automatic trigger system (ATS)
parameter.long_desc: Enabled on either AUX5 or MAIN5 depending on board. External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameter.name: FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG
parameter.short_desc: The PWM threshold from external automatic trigger system for engaging failsafe
parameter.long_desc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_P
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_P_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_R
parameter.long_desc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_R_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.

parameter.name: FD_IMB_PROP_THR
parameter.long_desc: Value at which the imbalanced propeller metric (based on horizontal and vertical acceleration variance) triggers a failure Setting this value to 0 disables the feature.

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_ALT_M
parameter.long_desc: Maintain altitude or track target's altitude. When maintaining the altitude, the drone can crash into terrain when the target moves uphill. When tracking the target's altitude, the follow altitude FLW_TGT_HT should be high enough to prevent terrain collisions due to GPS inaccuracies of the target.

values.value: 2D Tracking: Maintain constant altitude relative to home and track XY position only
2D + Terrain: Maintain constant altitude relative to terrain below and track XY position
3D Tracking: Track target's altitude (be aware that GPS altitude bias usually makes this useless)

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_DST
parameter.long_desc: The distance in meters to follow the target at

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_FA
parameter.long_desc: Angle to follow the target from. 0.0 Equals straight in front of the target's course (direction of motion) and the angle increases in clockwise direction, meaning Right-side would be 90.0 degrees while Left-side is -90.0 degrees Note: When the user force sets the angle out of the min/max range, it will be wrapped (e.g. 480 -> 120) in the range to gracefully handle the out of range.

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_HT
parameter.long_desc: Following height above the target

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_MAX_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum tangential velocity setting for generating the follow orbit trajectory
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum tangential velocity the drone will circle around the target whenever an orbit angle setpoint changes. Higher value means more aggressive follow behavior.

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_RS
parameter.short_desc: Responsiveness to target movement in Target Estimator
parameter.long_desc: lower values increase the responsiveness to changing position, but also ignore less noise

parameter.name: GPS_1_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Main GPS.

parameter.name: GPS_1_GNSS
parameter.short_desc: GNSS Systems for Primary GPS (integer bitmask)
parameter.long_desc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS 5 : Use NAVIC

parameter.name: GPS_1_PROTOCOL
parameter.long_desc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.

parameter.name: GPS_2_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Secondary GPS.

parameter.name: GPS_2_GNSS
parameter.short_desc: GNSS Systems for Secondary GPS (integer bitmask)
parameter.long_desc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS 5 : Use NAVIC

parameter.name: GPS_2_PROTOCOL
parameter.long_desc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.

parameter.name: GPS_DUMP_COMM
parameter.long_desc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message. If this is set to 2, the main GPS is configured to output RTCM data, which is then logged as gps_dump and can be used for PPK.

parameter.name: GPS_SAT_INFO
parameter.long_desc: Enable publication of satellite info (ORB_ID(satellite_info)) if possible. Not available on MTK.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_BAUD2
parameter.long_desc: Select a baudrate for the F9P's UART2 port. In GPS_UBX_MODE 1, 2, and 3, the F9P's UART2 port is configured to send/receive RTCM corrections. Set this to 57600 if you want to attach a telemetry radio on UART2.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL
parameter.long_desc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Select the u-blox configuration setup. Most setups will use the default, including RTK and dual GPS without heading. If rover has RTCM corrections from a static base (or other static correction source) coming in on UART2, then select Mode 5. The Heading mode requires 2 F9P devices to be attached. The main GPS will act as rover and output heading information, whereas the secondary will act as moving base. Modes 1 and 2 require each F9P UART1 to be connected to the Autopilot. In addition, UART2 on the F9P units are connected to each other. Modes 3 and 4 only require UART1 on each F9P connected to the Autopilot or Can Node. UART RX DMA is required. RTK is still possible with this setup.

values.value: Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Moving Base)
Moving Base (UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Rover)
Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
Moving Base (Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
Rover with Static Base on UART2 (similar to Default, except coming in on UART2)

parameter.name: GPS_YAW_OFFSET
parameter.short_desc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameter.long_desc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the rover (or Unicore primary) antenna is in front. The offset angle increases clockwise. Set this to 90 if the rover (or Unicore primary, or Septentrio Mosaic Aux) antenna is placed on the right side of the vehicle and the moving base antenna is on the left side. (Note: the Unicore primary antenna is the one connected on the right as seen from the top).

parameter.name: PPS_CAP_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: Enables the PPS capture module. This switches mode of FMU channel 7 to be the PPS input channel.

parameter.name: GF_ACTION
parameter.long_desc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence.

parameter.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from Home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameter.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from Home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameter.name: GF_PREDICT
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: This experimental feature may cause flyaways. Use at your own risk. Predict the motion of the vehicle and trigger the breach if it is determined that the current trajectory would result in a breach happening before the vehicle can make evasive maneuvers. The vehicle is then re-routed to a safe hold position (stop for multirotor, loiter for fixed wing).

parameter.name: GF_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameter.name: CA_AIRFRAME
parameter.long_desc: Defines which mixer implementation to use. Some are generic, while others are specifically fit to a certain vehicle with a fixed set of actuators. 'Custom' should only be used if noting else can be used.

parameter.name: CA_FAILURE_MODE
parameter.long_desc: This is used to specify how to handle motor failures reported by failure detector.

values.value: Remove first failed motor from effectiveness

parameter.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C0
parameter.long_desc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 0 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C1
parameter.long_desc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 1 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C2
parameter.long_desc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 2 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C3
parameter.long_desc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 3 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C4
parameter.long_desc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 4 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_THR_C0
parameter.long_desc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 0.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_THR_C1
parameter.long_desc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 1.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_THR_C2
parameter.long_desc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 2.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_THR_C3
parameter.long_desc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 3.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_THR_C4
parameter.long_desc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 4.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_YAW_CCW
parameter.long_desc: Default configuration is for a clockwise turning main rotor and positive thrust of the tail rotor is expected to rotate the vehicle clockwise. Set this parameter to true if the tail rotor provides thrust in counter-clockwise direction which is mostly the case when the main rotor turns counter-clockwise.

parameter.name: CA_HELI_YAW_CP_O
parameter.short_desc: Offset for yaw compensation based on collective pitch
parameter.long_desc: This allows to specify which collective pitch command results in the least amount of rotor drag. This is used to increase the accuracy of the yaw drag torque compensation based on collective pitch by aligning the lowest rotor drag with zero compensation. For symmetric profile blades this is the command that results in exactly 0° collective blade angle. For lift profile blades this is typically a command resulting in slightly negative collective blade angle. tail_output += CA_HELI_YAW_CP_S * abs(collective_pitch - CA_HELI_YAW_CP_O)

parameter.name: CA_HELI_YAW_CP_S
parameter.short_desc: Scale for yaw compensation based on collective pitch
parameter.long_desc: This allows to add a proportional factor of the collective pitch command to the yaw command. A negative value is needed when positive thrust of the tail rotor rotates the vehicle opposite to the main rotor turn direction. tail_output += CA_HELI_YAW_CP_S * abs(collective_pitch - CA_HELI_YAW_CP_O)

parameter.name: CA_HELI_YAW_TH_S
parameter.short_desc: Scale for yaw compensation based on throttle
parameter.long_desc: This allows to add a proportional factor of the throttle command to the yaw command. A negative value is needed when positive thrust of the tail rotor rotates the vehicle opposite to the main rotor turn direction. tail_output += CA_HELI_YAW_TH_S * throttle

parameter.name: CA_METHOD
parameter.long_desc: Selects the algorithm and desaturation method. If set to Automtic, the selection is based on the airframe (CA_AIRFRAME).

parameter.name: CA_R0_SLEW
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through the full output range. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 0 to 1 in minimum x seconds (in case of reversible motors, the range is -1 to 1). Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: CA_R10_SLEW
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through the full output range. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 0 to 1 in minimum x seconds (in case of reversible motors, the range is -1 to 1). Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: CA_R11_SLEW
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through the full output range. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 0 to 1 in minimum x seconds (in case of reversible motors, the range is -1 to 1). Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: CA_R9_SLEW
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through the full output range. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 0 to 1 in minimum x seconds (in case of reversible motors, the range is -1 to 1). Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_AX
parameter.short_desc: Axis of rotor 0 thrust vector, X body axis component
parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_AY
parameter.short_desc: Axis of rotor 0 thrust vector, Y body axis component
parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_AZ
parameter.short_desc: Axis of rotor 0 thrust vector, Z body axis component
parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_CT
parameter.long_desc: The thrust coefficient if defined as Thrust = CT * u^2, where u (with value between actuator minimum and maximum) is the output signal sent to the motor controller.

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_KM
parameter.long_desc: The moment coefficient if defined as Torque = KM * Thrust. Use a positive value for a rotor with CCW rotation. Use a negative value for a rotor with CW rotation.

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_PX
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 0 along X body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_PY
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 0 along Y body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_PZ
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 0 along Z body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR0_TILT
parameter.long_desc: If not set to None, this motor is tilted by the configured tilt servo.

parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_AZ
parameter.short_desc: Axis of rotor 6 thrust vector, Z body axis component
parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_CT
parameter.long_desc: The thrust coefficient if defined as Thrust = CT * u^2, where u (with value between actuator minimum and maximum) is the output signal sent to the motor controller.

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_KM
parameter.long_desc: The moment coefficient if defined as Torque = KM * Thrust. Use a positive value for a rotor with CCW rotation. Use a negative value for a rotor with CW rotation.

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_PX
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 6 along X body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_PY
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 6 along Y body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_PZ
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 6 along Z body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR6_TILT
parameter.long_desc: If not set to None, this motor is tilted by the configured tilt servo.

parameter.short_desc: Axis of rotor 7 thrust vector, X body axis component
parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.long_desc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR7_KM

parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 7 along X body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR7_PY
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 7 along Y body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR7_PZ
parameter.short_desc: Position of rotor 7 along Z body axis relative to center of gravity

parameter.name: CA_ROTOR7_TILT

parameter.long_desc: The thrust coefficient if defined as Thrust = CT * u^2, where u (with value between actuator minimum and maximum) is the output signal sent to the motor controller.
