parameter.name: RC_CHAN_CNT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used by Ground Station software to save the number of channels which were used during RC calibration. It is only meant for ground station use.

parameter.name: RC_FAILS_THR
parameter.long_desc: Use RC_MAP_FAILSAFE to specify which channel is used to indicate RC loss via this threshold. By default this is the throttle channel. Set to a PWM value slightly above the PWM value for the channel (e.g. throttle) in a failsafe event, but below the minimum PWM value for the channel during normal operation. Note: The default value of 0 disables the feature (it is below the expected range).

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX1
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera pitch

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX2
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera roll

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX3
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera azimuth / yaw

parameter.name: RC_MAP_ENG_MOT
parameter.short_desc: RC channel to engage the main motor (for helicopters)

parameter.name: RC_MAP_FAILSAFE
parameter.long_desc: Configures which RC channel is used by the receiver to indicate the signal was lost (on receivers that use output a fixed signal value to report lost signal). If set to 0, the channel mapped to throttle is used. Use RC_FAILS_THR to set the threshold indicating lost signal. By default it's below the expected range and hence disabled.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PARAM1
parameter.long_desc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 1st parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PARAM2
parameter.long_desc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 2nd parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PARAM3
parameter.long_desc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 3th parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_THROTTLE
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_YAW
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN
parameter.short_desc: PWM input channel that provides RSSI
parameter.long_desc: 0: do not read RSSI from input channel 1-18: read RSSI from specified input channel Specify the range for RSSI input with RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN and RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX parameters.

parameter.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max input value for RSSI reading
parameter.long_desc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameter.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Min input value for RSSI reading
parameter.long_desc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameter.name: TRIM_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight.

parameter.name: TRIM_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight.

parameter.name: TRIM_YAW
parameter.long_desc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight.

parameter.name: RC_ARMSWITCH_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_ENG_MOT_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for selecting main motor engage
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_GEAR_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for the landing gear switch
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_KILLSWITCH_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_LOITER_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_MAP_ARM_SW
parameter.long_desc: Use it to arm/disarm via switch instead of default throttle stick. If this is assigned, arming and disarming via stick is disabled.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_FLTMODE
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is non-zero, flight modes are only selected by this channel and are assigned to six slots.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN
parameter.long_desc: This bitmask allows to specify multiple channels for changing flight modes using momentary buttons. Each channel is assigned to a mode slot ((lowest channel = slot 1). The resulting modes for each slot X is defined by the COM_FLTMODEX parameters. The functionality can be used only if RC_MAP_FLTMODE is disabled. The maximum number of available slots and hence bits set in the mask is 6.

bitmask.bit: Mask Channel 1 as a mode button
Mask Channel 2 as a mode button
Mask Channel 3 as a mode button
Mask Channel 4 as a mode button
Mask Channel 5 as a mode button
Mask Channel 6 as a mode button
Mask Channel 7 as a mode button
Mask Channel 8 as a mode button
Mask Channel 9 as a mode button
Mask Channel 10 as a mode button
Mask Channel 11 as a mode button
Mask Channel 12 as a mode button
Mask Channel 13 as a mode button
Mask Channel 14 as a mode button
Mask Channel 15 as a mode button
Mask Channel 16 as a mode button
Mask Channel 17 as a mode button
Mask Channel 18 as a mode button

parameter.name: RC_MAP_MODE_SW
parameter.long_desc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_OFFB_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_PAYLOAD_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for selecting payload power switch
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_RETURN_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_TRANS_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for the VTOL transition switch
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RTL_CONE_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Half-angle of the return mode altitude cone
parameter.long_desc: Defines the half-angle of a cone centered around the destination position that affects the altitude at which the vehicle returns.

values.value: No cone, always climb to RTL_RETURN_ALT above destination.
Only climb to at least RTL_DESCEND_ALT above destination.

parameter.name: RTL_DESCEND_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Descend to this altitude (above destination position) after return, and wait for time defined in RTL_LAND_DELAY. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed. VTOLs do transition to hover in this altitdue above the landing point.

parameter.name: RTL_LAND_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: Delay before landing (after initial descent) in Return mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at RTL_DESCEND_ALT.

parameter.name: RTL_LOITER_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Set the radius for loitering to a safe altitude for VTOL transition.

parameter.name: RTL_MIN_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal radius from return point within which special rules for return mode apply
parameter.long_desc: The return altitude will be calculated based on RTL_CONE_ANG parameter. The yaw setpoint will switch to the one defined by corresponding waypoint.

parameter.name: RTL_PLD_MD
parameter.long_desc: Use precision landing when doing an RTL landing phase.

parameter.name: RTL_RETURN_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Default minimum altitude above destination (e.g. home, safe point, landing pattern) for return flight. The vehicle will climb to this altitude when Return mode is enganged, unless it currently is flying higher already. This is affected by RTL_MIN_DIST and RTL_CONE_ANG.

parameter.name: RTL_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Return mode destination and flight path (home location, rally point, mission landing pattern, reverse mission)

values.value: Return to closest safe point (home or rally point) via direct path.

Return to closest safe point other than home (mission landing pattern or rally point), via direct path. If no mission landing or rally points are defined return home via direct path. Always chose closest safe landing point if vehicle is a VTOL in hover mode.
Return to a planned mission landing, if available, using the mission path, else return to home via the reverse mission path. Do not consider rally points.
Return via direct path to closest destination: home, start of mission landing pattern or safe point. If the destination is a mission landing pattern, follow the pattern to land.

parameter.name: RTL_APPR_FORCE
parameter.long_desc: Only consider RTL point, if it has an approach defined.

parameter.name: RTL_TIME_FACTOR
parameter.short_desc: RTL time estimate safety margin factor
parameter.long_desc: Safety factor that is used to scale the actual RTL time estimate. Time with margin = RTL_TIME_FACTOR * time + RTL_TIME_MARGIN

parameter.name: RTL_TIME_MARGIN
parameter.short_desc: RTL time estimate safety margin offset
parameter.long_desc: Margin that is added to the time estimate, after it has already been scaled Time with margin = RTL_TIME_FACTOR * time + RTL_TIME_MARGIN

parameter.name: RBCLW_SER_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Roboclaw Driver.

parameter.name: RBCLW_ADDRESS
parameter.short_desc: Address of the ESC on the bus
parameter.long_desc: The ESC has to be configured to have an address from 0x80 to 0x87. This parameter needs to match the configured value.

parameter.name: RBCLW_COUNTS_REV
parameter.short_desc: Number of encoder counts for one wheel revolution
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 1200 corresponds to the default configuration of the Aion R1 rover.

parameter.name: RA_ACC_RAD_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: The geometric ideal acceptance radius is multiplied by this factor to account for kinematic and dynamic effects. Higher value -> The rover starts to cut the corner earlier.

parameter.name: RA_ACC_RAD_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum acceptance radius for the waypoints
parameter.long_desc: The controller scales the acceptance radius based on the angle between the previous, current and next waypoint. Higher value -> smoother trajectory at the cost of how close the rover gets to the waypoint (Set to -1 to disable corner cutting).

parameter.name: RA_LAT_ACCEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for lateral acceleration controller

parameter.name: RA_LAT_ACCEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for lateral acceleration controller

parameter.name: RA_MAX_ACCEL
parameter.long_desc: This is used for the acceleration slew rate.

parameter.name: RA_MAX_DECEL
parameter.long_desc: This is used for the deceleration slew rate, the feed-forward term for the speed controller during missions and the corner slow down effect. Note: For the corner slow down effect RA_MAX_JERK also has to be set.

parameter.name: RA_MAX_JERK
parameter.long_desc: Limit for forwards acc/deceleration change. This is used for the corner slow down effect. Note: RA_MAX_DECEL also has to be set for this to be enabled.

parameter.name: RA_MAX_LAT_ACCEL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to cap the lateral acceleration and map controller inputs to desired lateral acceleration in Acro, Stabilized and Position mode.

parameter.name: RA_MAX_SPEED
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum allowed speed setpoint when driving in a mode that uses closed loop speed control.

parameter.name: RA_MAX_STR_ANG
parameter.long_desc: The maximum angle that the rover can steer

parameter.name: RA_MAX_STR_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum steering rate for the rover

parameter.name: RA_MAX_THR_SPEED
parameter.short_desc: Speed the rover drives at maximum throttle
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to calculate the feedforward term of the closed loop speed control which linearly maps desired speeds to normalized motor commands [-1. 1]. A good starting point is the observed ground speed when the rover drives at maximum throttle in manual mode. Increase this parameter if the rover is faster than the setpoint, and decrease if the rover is slower.

parameter.name: RA_SPEED_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for ground speed controller

parameter.name: RA_SPEED_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for ground speed controller

parameter.name: RA_WHEEL_BASE
parameter.long_desc: Distance from the front to the rear axle

parameter.name: RD_MAX_ACCEL
parameter.long_desc: Maximum acceleration is used to limit the acceleration of the rover

parameter.name: RD_MAX_DECEL
parameter.long_desc: Maximum decelaration is used to limit the deceleration of the rover. Set to -1 to disable, causing the rover to decelerate as fast as possible. Caution: This disables the slow down effect in auto modes.

parameter.name: RD_MAX_JERK
parameter.long_desc: Limit for forwards acc/deceleration change.

parameter.name: RD_MAX_SPEED
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to cap desired forward speed and map controller inputs to desired speeds in Position mode.

parameter.name: RD_MAX_THR_SPD
parameter.short_desc: Speed the rover drives at maximum throttle
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to calculate the feedforward term of the closed loop speed control which linearly maps desired speeds to normalized motor commands [-1. 1]. A good starting point is the observed ground speed when the rover drives at maximum throttle in manual mode. Increase this parameter if the rover is faster than the setpoint, and decrease if the rover is slower.

parameter.name: RD_MAX_THR_YAW_R
parameter.short_desc: Yaw rate turning left/right wheels at max speed in opposite directions
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to calculate the feedforward term of the closed loop yaw rate control. The controller first calculates the required speed difference between the left and right motor to achieve the desired yaw rate. This desired speed difference is then linearly mapped to normalized motor commands. A good starting point is twice the speed the rover drives at maximum throttle (RD_MAX_THR_SPD)). Increase this parameter if the rover turns faster than the setpoint, and decrease if the rover turns slower.

parameter.name: RD_MAX_YAW_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed yaw acceleration for the rover
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to cap desired yaw acceleration. This is used to adjust incoming yaw rate setpoints to a feasible yaw rate setpoint based on the physical limitation on how fast the yaw rate can change. This leads to a smooth setpoint trajectory for the closed loop yaw rate controller to track. Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: RD_MAX_YAW_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed yaw rate for the rover
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to cap desired yaw rates and map controller inputs to desired yaw rates in Acro,Stabilized and Position mode.

parameter.name: RD_MISS_SPD_GAIN
parameter.short_desc: Tuning parameter for the speed reduction during waypoint transition
parameter.long_desc: The waypoint transition speed is calculated as: Transition_speed = Maximum_speed * (1 - normalized_transition_angle * RM_MISS_VEL_GAIN) The normalized transition angle is the angle between the line segment from prev-curr WP and curr-next WP interpolated from [0, 180] -> [0, 1]. Higher value -> More speed reduction during waypoint transitions.

parameter.name: RD_SPEED_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for closed loop forward speed controller

parameter.name: RD_SPEED_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for closed loop forward speed controller

parameter.name: RD_TRANS_DRV_TRN
parameter.short_desc: Yaw error threshhold to switch from driving to spot turning
parameter.long_desc: This threshold is used for the state machine to switch from driving to turning based on the error between the desired and actual yaw. It is also used as the threshold whether the rover should come to a smooth stop at the next waypoint. This slow down effect is active if the angle between the line segments from prevWP-currWP and currWP-nextWP is smaller then 180 - RD_TRANS_DRV_TRN.

parameter.name: RD_TRANS_TRN_DRV
parameter.short_desc: Yaw error threshhold to switch from spot turning to driving

parameter.name: RD_WHEEL_TRACK
parameter.long_desc: Distance from the center of the right wheel to the center of the left wheel

parameter.name: RD_YAW_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for closed loop yaw controller

parameter.name: RD_YAW_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for closed loop yaw controller

parameter.name: RD_YAW_RATE_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for closed loop yaw rate controller

parameter.name: RD_YAW_RATE_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for closed loop yaw rate controller

parameter.name: RM_MAX_ACCEL
parameter.long_desc: Maximum acceleration is used to limit the acceleration of the rover

parameter.name: RM_MAX_DECEL
parameter.long_desc: Maximum decelaration is used to limit the deceleration of the rover. Set to -1 to disable, causing the rover to decelerate as fast as possible. Caution: Disabling the deceleration limit also disables the slow down effect in auto modes.

parameter.name: RM_MAX_JERK
parameter.long_desc: Limit for forwards acc/deceleration change.

parameter.name: RM_MAX_SPEED
parameter.short_desc: Maximum speed the rover is allowed to drive
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used cap the maximum speed the rover is allowed to drive and to map stick inputs to desired speeds in position mode.

parameter.name: RM_MAX_THR_SPD
parameter.short_desc: Speed the rover drives at maximum throttle
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to calculate the feedforward term of the closed loop speed control which linearly maps desired speeds to normalized motor commands [-1. 1]. A good starting point is the observed ground speed when the rover drives at maximum throttle in manual mode. Increase this parameter if the rover is faster than the setpoint, and decrease if the rover is slower.

parameter.name: RM_MAX_THR_YAW_R
parameter.short_desc: Yaw rate turning left/right wheels at max speed in opposite directions
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to calculate the feedforward term of the closed loop yaw rate control. The controller first calculates the required speed difference between the left and right motor to achieve the desired yaw rate. This desired speed difference is then linearly mapped to normalized motor commands. A good starting point is twice the speed the rover drives at maximum throttle (RM_MAX_THRTL_SPD)). Increase this parameter if the rover turns faster than the setpoint, and decrease if the rover turns slower.

parameter.name: RM_MAX_YAW_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed yaw acceleration for the rover
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to cap desired yaw acceleration. This is used to adjust incoming yaw rate setpoints to a feasible yaw rate setpoint based on the physical limitation on how fast the yaw rate can change. This leads to a smooth setpoint trajectory for the closed loop yaw rate controller to track. Set to -1 to disable.

parameter.name: RM_MAX_YAW_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed yaw rate for the rover
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used to cap desired yaw rates and map controller inputs to desired yaw rates in acro mode.

parameter.name: RM_MISS_VEL_GAIN
parameter.short_desc: Tuning parameter for the velocity reduction during waypoint transition
parameter.long_desc: The waypoint transition speed is calculated as: Transition_speed = Maximum_speed * (1 - normalized_transition_angle * RM_MISS_VEL_GAIN) The normalized transition angle is the angle between the line segment from prev-curr WP and curr-next WP interpolated from [0, 180] -> [0, 1]. Higher value -> More velocity reduction during cornering.

parameter.name: RM_SPEED_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for ground speed controller

parameter.name: RM_WHEEL_TRACK
parameter.long_desc: Distance from the center of the right wheels to the center of the left wheels.

parameter.name: RM_YAW_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for closed loop yaw controller

parameter.name: RM_YAW_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for closed loop yaw controller

parameter.name: RM_YAW_RATE_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for the closed-loop yaw rate controller

parameter.name: RM_YAW_RATE_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for the closed-loop yaw rate controller

parameter.name: GND_L1_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameter.name: GND_L1_DIST
parameter.long_desc: This is the distance at which the next waypoint is activated. This should be set to about 2-4x of GND_WHEEL_BASE and not smaller than one meter (due to GPS accuracy).

parameter.name: GND_L1_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the rover it's following. Use values around 2-5m for a 0.3m wheel base. Tuning instructions: Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameter.name: GND_MAX_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum turn angle for Ackerman steering
parameter.long_desc: At a control output of 0, the steering wheels are at 0 radians. At a control output of 1, the steering wheels are at GND_MAX_ANG radians.

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_D
parameter.long_desc: This is the derivative gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_I
parameter.long_desc: This is the integral gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maxim value the integral can reach to prevent wind-up.

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_P
parameter.long_desc: This is the proportional gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_THR_SC
parameter.long_desc: This is a gain to map the speed control output to the throttle linearly.

parameter.name: GND_SP_CTRL_MODE
parameter.long_desc: This allows the user to choose between closed loop gps speed or open loop cruise throttle speed

values.value: close the loop with gps speed

parameter.name: GND_THR_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. 10% is ok for a traxxas stampede vxl with ESC set to training mode

parameter.name: GND_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For a Traxxas stampede vxl with the ESC set to training, 30 % is enough

parameter.name: GND_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. Set to 0 for rover

parameter.name: GND_WHEEL_BASE
parameter.short_desc: Distance from front axle to rear axle
parameter.long_desc: A value of 0.31 is typical for 1/10 RC cars.

parameter.name: RWTO_HDG
parameter.short_desc: Specifies which heading should be held during the runway takeoff ground roll
parameter.long_desc: 0: airframe heading when takeoff is initiated 1: position control along runway direction (bearing defined from vehicle position on takeoff initiation to MAV_CMD_TAKEOFF position defined by operator)

parameter.name: RWTO_NPFG_PERIOD
parameter.short_desc: NPFG period while steering on runway

parameter.name: RWTO_NUDGE
parameter.short_desc: Enable use of yaw stick for nudging the wheel during runway ground roll
parameter.long_desc: This is useful when map, GNSS, or yaw errors on ground are misaligned with what the operator intends for takeoff course. Particularly useful for skinny runways or if the wheel servo is a bit off trim.

parameter.name: RWTO_PSP
parameter.short_desc: Pitch setpoint during taxi / before takeoff rotation airspeed is reached
parameter.long_desc: A taildragger with steerable wheel might need to pitch up a little to keep its wheel on the ground before airspeed to takeoff is reached.

parameter.name: RWTO_RAMP_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Throttle ramp up time for runway takeoff

parameter.name: RWTO_ROT_AIRSPD
parameter.long_desc: The calibrated airspeed threshold during the takeoff ground roll when the plane should start rotating (pitching up). Must be less than the takeoff airspeed, will otherwise be capped at the takeoff airpeed (see FW_TKO_AIRSPD). If set <= 0.0, defaults to 0.9 * takeoff airspeed (see FW_TKO_AIRSPD)

parameter.name: RWTO_ROT_TIME
parameter.long_desc: This is the time desired to linearly ramp in takeoff pitch constraints during the takeoff rotation

parameter.name: SDLOG_ALGORITHM
parameter.long_desc: Selects the algorithm used for logfile encryption

parameter.name: SDLOG_BOOT_BAT
parameter.long_desc: When enabled, logging will not start from boot if battery power is not detected (e.g. powered via USB on a test bench). This prevents extraneous flight logs from being created during bench testing. Note that this only applies to log-from-boot modes. This has no effect on arm-based modes.

parameter.name: SDLOG_DIRS_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum number of log directories to keep
parameter.long_desc: If there are more log directories than this value, the system will delete the oldest directories during startup. In addition, the system will delete old logs if there is not enough free space left. The minimum amount is 300 MB. If this is set to 0, old directories will only be removed if the free space falls below the minimum. Note: this does not apply to mission log files.

parameter.name: SDLOG_EXCH_KEY
parameter.long_desc: If the logfile is encrypted using a symmetric key algorithm, the used encryption key is generated at logging start and stored on the sdcard RSA2048 encrypted using this key.

parameter.name: SDLOG_KEY
parameter.long_desc: Selects the key in keystore, used for encrypting the log. When using a symmetric encryption algorithm, the key is generated at logging start and kept stored in this index. For symmetric algorithms, the key is volatile and valid only for the duration of logging. The key is stored in encrypted format on the sdcard alongside the logfile, using an RSA2048 key defined by the SDLOG_EXCHANGE_KEY

parameter.name: SDLOG_MISSION
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, a small additional "mission" log file will be written to the SD card. The log contains just those messages that are useful for tasks like generating flight statistics and geotagging. The different modes can be used to further reduce the logged data (and thus the log file size). For example, choose geotagging mode to only log data required for geotagging. Note that the normal/full log is still created, and contains all the data in the mission log (and more).

parameter.name: SDLOG_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Determines when to start and stop logging. By default, logging is started when arming the system, and stopped when disarming.

parameter.name: SDLOG_PROFILE
parameter.long_desc: This integer bitmask controls the set and rates of logged topics. The default allows for general log analysis while keeping the log file size reasonably small. Enabling multiple sets leads to higher bandwidth requirements and larger log files. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Default set (used for general log analysis) 1 : Full rate estimator (EKF2) replay topics 2 : Topics for thermal calibration (high rate raw IMU and Baro sensor data) 3 : Topics for system identification (high rate actuator control and IMU data) 4 : Full rates for analysis of fast maneuvers (RC, attitude, rates and actuators) 5 : Debugging topics (debug_*.msg topics, for custom code) 6 : Topics for sensor comparison (low rate raw IMU, Baro and magnetometer data) 7 : Topics for computer vision and collision avoidance 8 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Gyro) 9 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Accel) 10: Logging of mavlink tunnel message (useful for payload communication debugging)

parameter.name: SDLOG_UTC_OFFSET
parameter.long_desc: the difference in hours and minutes from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for a your place and date. for example, In case of South Korea(UTC+09:00), UTC offset is 540 min (9*60) refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_time_offsets

parameter.name: SDLOG_UUID
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1, add an ID to the log, which uniquely identifies the vehicle

parameter.name: SIM_BAT_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: Enable or disable the internal battery simulation. This is useful when the battery is simulated externally and interfaced with PX4 through MAVLink for example.

parameter.name: SIM_BAT_MIN_PCT
parameter.long_desc: Can be used to alter the battery level during SITL- or HITL-simulation on the fly. Particularly useful for testing different low-battery behaviour.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC0_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the accelerometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC0_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC1_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the accelerometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC1_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC2_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the accelerometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC2_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC3_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the accelerometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC3_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_BARO0_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the barometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_BARO1_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the barometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_BARO2_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the barometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_BARO3_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the barometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO0_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the gyroscope this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO0_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO1_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the gyroscope this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO1_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO2_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the gyroscope this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO2_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO3_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the gyroscope this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO3_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the magnetometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG0_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG0_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero. Set to "Custom Euler Angle" to define the rotation using CAL_MAG0_ROLL, CAL_MAG0_PITCH and CAL_MAG0_YAW.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_XCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_XODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 0 X-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_YAW
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG0_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_YCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_YODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 0 Y-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ZCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ZODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 0 Z-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the magnetometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG1_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG1_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero. Set to "Custom Euler Angle" to define the rotation using CAL_MAG1_ROLL, CAL_MAG1_PITCH and CAL_MAG1_YAW.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_XCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_XODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 1 X-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_YAW
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG1_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_YCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_YODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 1 Y-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ZCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ZODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 1 Z-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the magnetometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG2_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG2_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero. Set to "Custom Euler Angle" to define the rotation using CAL_MAG2_ROLL, CAL_MAG2_PITCH and CAL_MAG2_YAW.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_XCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_XODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 2 X-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_YAW
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG2_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_YCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_YODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 2 Y-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ZCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ZODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 2 Z-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ID
parameter.long_desc: Device ID of the magnetometer this calibration applies to.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG3_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG3_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ROT
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero. Set to "Custom Euler Angle" to define the rotation using CAL_MAG3_ROLL, CAL_MAG3_PITCH and CAL_MAG3_YAW.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_XCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_XODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 3 X-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_YAW
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter changes CAL_MAG3_ROT to "Custom Euler Angle"

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_YCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_YODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 3 Y-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ZCOMP
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ZODIAG
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer 3 Z-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameter.long_desc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameter.long_desc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXR
parameter.short_desc: Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor
parameter.long_desc: Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground is less than 50% of this value.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MINHGT
parameter.short_desc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.

parameter.name: ADC_ADS1115_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, the internal ADC is not used.

parameter.name: BAT1_C_MULT
parameter.short_desc: Capacity/current multiplier for high-current capable SMBUS battery

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_CMODEL
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed sensor compensation model for the SDP3x
parameter.long_desc: Model with Pitot CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Model without Pitot (1.5 mm tubes) CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Tube Pressure Drop CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Diameter in mm of the pitot and tubes, must have the same diameter. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor and the static + dynamic port length of the pitot.

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_TUBELEN
parameter.long_desc: See the CAL_AIR_CMODEL explanation on how this parameter should be set.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG_SIDES
parameter.long_desc: Use SENS_MAG_SIDES instead

parameter.name: IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for accel
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary accelerometer. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Cutoff frequency for angular acceleration (D-Term filter)
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter used on the time derivative of the measured angular velocity, also known as the D-term filter in the rate controller. The D-term uses the derivative of the rate and thus is the most susceptible to noise. Therefore, using a D-term filter allows to increase IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF, which leads to reduced control latency and permits to increase the P gains. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for gyro
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary gyro. This only affects the angular velocity sent to the controllers, not the estimators. It applies also to the angular acceleration (D-Term filter), see IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_BW
parameter.short_desc: IMU gyro ESC notch filter bandwidth
parameter.long_desc: Bandwidth per notch filter when using dynamic notch filtering with ESC RPM.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_EN
parameter.long_desc: Enable bank of dynamically updating notch filters. Requires ESC RPM feedback or onboard FFT (IMU_GYRO_FFT_EN).

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_HMC
parameter.short_desc: IMU gyro dynamic notch filter harmonics
parameter.long_desc: ESC RPM number of harmonics (multiples of RPM) for ESC RPM dynamic notch filtering.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_MIN
parameter.short_desc: IMU gyro dynamic notch filter minimum frequency
parameter.long_desc: Minimum notch filter frequency in Hz.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_NF0_BW
parameter.long_desc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF0_FRQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_NF0_FRQ
parameter.long_desc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF0_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_NF1_BW
parameter.long_desc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF1_FRQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_NF1_FRQ
parameter.long_desc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF1_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_RATEMAX
parameter.short_desc: Gyro control data maximum publication rate (inner loop rate)
parameter.long_desc: The maximum rate the gyro control data (vehicle_angular_velocity) will be allowed to publish at. This is the loop rate for the rate controller and outputs. Note: sensor data is always read and filtered at the full raw rate (eg commonly 8 kHz) regardless of this setting.

parameter.name: IMU_INTEG_RATE
parameter.long_desc: The rate at which raw IMU data is integrated to produce delta angles and delta velocities. Recommended to set this to a multiple of the estimator update period (currently 10 ms for ekf2).

parameter.name: INA220_CUR_BAT
parameter.short_desc: INA220 Power Monitor Battery Max Current

parameter.name: INA220_CUR_REG
parameter.short_desc: INA220 Power Monitor Regulator Max Current

parameter.name: PCF8583_MAGNET
parameter.long_desc: Nmumber of signals per rotation of actuator

parameter.name: PCF8583_POOL
parameter.long_desc: Determines how often the sensor is read out.

parameter.name: PCF8583_RESET
parameter.long_desc: Internal device counter is reset to 0 when overrun this value, counter is able to store up to 6 digits reset of counter takes some time - measurement with reset has worse accuracy. 0 means reset counter after every measurement.

parameter.name: SENS_AFBR_HYSTER
parameter.short_desc: AFBR Rangefinder Short/Long Range Threshold Hysteresis
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the hysteresis for switching between short and long range mode.

parameter.name: SENS_AFBR_L_RATE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines measurement rate of the AFBR Rangefinder in long range mode.

parameter.name: SENS_AFBR_MODE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the mode of the AFBR Rangefinder.

parameter.name: SENS_AFBR_S_RATE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines measurement rate of the AFBR Rangefinder in short range mode.

parameter.name: SENS_AFBR_THRESH
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the threshold for switching between short and long range mode. The mode will switch from short to long range when the distance is greater than the threshold plus the hysteresis. The mode will switch from long to short range when the distance is less than the threshold minus the hysteresis.

parameter.name: SENS_BARO_RATE
parameter.long_desc: Barometric air data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual barometric data rate is still dependent on the sensor.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_CM8JL65_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Lanbao PSK-CM8JL65-CC5.

parameter.name: SENS_CM8JL65_R_0
parameter.long_desc: Distance Sensor Rotation as MAV_SENSOR_ORIENTATION enum

parameter.name: SENS_EN_AUAVX
parameter.short_desc: Amphenol AUAV differential / absolute pressure sensor (external I2C)

values.value: Sensor disabled, when explicitly started treated as AUAV L05D

parameter.name: SENS_EN_BATT
parameter.short_desc: SMBUS Smart battery driver BQ40Z50 and BQ40Z80

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA220
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA220 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA226
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA226 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA228
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA228 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA238
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA238 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_MS4515
parameter.short_desc: TE MS4515 differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EN_MS4525DO
parameter.short_desc: TE MS4525DO differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EN_MS5525DS
parameter.short_desc: TE MS5525DSO differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EN_PCF8583
parameter.long_desc: Run PCF8583 driver automatically

parameter.name: SENS_EN_SDP3X
parameter.short_desc: Sensirion SDP3X differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EN_SF45_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for Lightware SF45 Rangefinder (serial)
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Lightware SF45 Rangefinder (serial).

parameter.name: SENS_EXT_I2C_PRB
parameter.long_desc: Probe for optional external I2C devices.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_RATE
parameter.long_desc: Optical flow data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual optical flow data rate is still dependent on the sensor.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the optical flow relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle.

parameter.name: SENS_FTX_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for FT Technologies Digital Wind Sensor (serial)
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run FT Technologies Digital Wind Sensor (serial).

parameter.name: SENS_GPS_MASK
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy

parameter.name: SENS_GPS_PRIME
parameter.long_desc: When no blending is active, this defines the preferred GPS receiver instance. The GPS selection logic waits until the primary receiver is available to send data to the EKF even if a secondary instance is already available. The secondary instance is then only used if the primary one times out. To have an equal priority of all the instances, set this parameter to -1 and the best receiver will be used. This parameter has no effect if blending is active.

parameter.name: SENS_GPS_TAU
parameter.long_desc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_AUTOCAL
parameter.long_desc: Automatically initialize IMU (accel/gyro) calibration from bias estimates if available.

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_CLPNOTI
parameter.long_desc: Notify the user if the IMU is clipping

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_I
parameter.short_desc: IMU heater controller integrator gain value

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_P
parameter.short_desc: IMU heater controller proportional gain value

parameter.name: SENS_INT_BARO_EN
parameter.long_desc: For systems with an external barometer, this should be set to false to make sure that the external is used.

parameter.name: SENS_LEDDAR1_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run LeddarOne Rangefinder.

parameter.name: SENS_MAG_AUTOCAL
parameter.long_desc: Automatically initialize magnetometer calibration from bias estimate if available.

parameter.name: SENS_MAG_AUTOROT
parameter.long_desc: During calibration attempt to automatically determine the rotation of external magnetometers.

parameter.name: SENS_MAG_RATE
parameter.long_desc: Magnetometer data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual magnetometer data rate is still dependent on the sensor.

parameter.name: SENS_MAG_SIDES
parameter.short_desc: Bitfield selecting mag sides for calibration
parameter.long_desc: If set to two side calibration, only the offsets are estimated, the scale calibration is left unchanged. Thus an initial six side calibration is recommended. Bits: ORIENTATION_TAIL_DOWN = 1 ORIENTATION_NOSE_DOWN = 2 ORIENTATION_LEFT = 4 ORIENTATION_RIGHT = 8 ORIENTATION_UPSIDE_DOWN = 16 ORIENTATION_RIGHTSIDE_UP = 32

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_0_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_10_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_11_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_1_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_2_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_3_ROT

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_4_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_5_ROT

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_6_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_7_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_8_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_9_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT0_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT10_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT11_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT1_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT2_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT3_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT4_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT5_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT6_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT7_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT8_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT9_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_OR_ADIS164X
parameter.short_desc: Analog Devices ADIS16448 IMU Orientation(external SPI)

parameter.name: SENS_SF0X_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for Lightware Laser Rangefinder (serial)
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Lightware Laser Rangefinder (serial).

parameter.name: SENS_TEMP_ID
parameter.short_desc: Target IMU device ID to regulate temperature

parameter.name: SENS_TFLOW_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for ThoneFlow-3901U optical flow sensor
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run ThoneFlow-3901U optical flow sensor.

parameter.name: SENS_TFMINI_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for Benewake TFmini Rangefinder
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Benewake TFmini Rangefinder.

parameter.name: SENS_ULAND_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run uLanding Radar.

parameter.name: SENS_VN_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for VectorNav (VN-100, VN-200, VN-300)
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run VectorNav (VN-100, VN-200, VN-300).

parameter.name: SF45_ORIENT_CFG
parameter.long_desc: The SF45 mounted facing upward or downward on the frame

parameter.name: SF45_UPDATE_CFG
parameter.long_desc: The SF45 sets the update rate in Hz to allow greater resolution

parameter.name: SF45_YAW_CFG
parameter.long_desc: The usb port on the sensor indicates 180deg, opposite usb is forward facing

parameter.name: SIM_ARSPD_FAIL
parameter.short_desc: Dynamically simulate failure of airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: VN_MODE
parameter.long_desc: INS or sensors

parameter.name: SEP_AUTO_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: By default, the receiver is automatically configured. Sometimes it may be used for multiple purposes. If the offered parameters aren't sufficient, this parameter can be disabled to have full control of the receiver configuration. A good way to use this is to enable automatic configuration, let the receiver be configured, and then disable it to make manual adjustments.

parameter.name: SEP_CONST_USAGE
parameter.long_desc: Choice of which constellations the receiver should use for PVT computation. When this is 0, the constellation usage isn't changed.

parameter.name: SEP_DUMP_COMM
parameter.long_desc: Log raw communication between the driver and connected receivers. For example, "To receiver" will log all commands and corrections sent by the driver to the receiver.

parameter.name: SEP_HARDW_SETUP
parameter.short_desc: Setup and expected use of the hardware
parameter.long_desc: Setup and expected use of the hardware. - Default: Use two receivers as completely separate instances. - Moving base: Use two receivers in a rover & moving base setup for heading.

parameter.name: SEP_LOG_FORCE
parameter.short_desc: Whether to overwrite or add to existing logging
parameter.long_desc: When the receiver is already set up to log data, this decides whether extra logged data should be added or overwrite existing data.

parameter.name: SEP_LOG_HZ
parameter.long_desc: Select the frequency at which the connected receiver should log data to its internal storage.

parameter.name: SEP_LOG_LEVEL
parameter.long_desc: Select the level of detail that needs to be logged by the receiver.

parameter.name: SEP_OUTP_HZ
parameter.short_desc: Output frequency of main SBF blocks
parameter.long_desc: The output frequency of the main SBF blocks needed for PVT information.

parameter.name: SEP_PITCH_OFFS
parameter.short_desc: Pitch offset for dual antenna GPS
parameter.long_desc: Vertical offsets can be compensated for by adjusting the Pitch offset. Note that this can be interpreted as the "roll" angle in case the antennas are aligned along the perpendicular axis. This occurs in situations where the two antenna ARPs may not be exactly at the same height in the vehicle reference frame. Since pitch is defined as the right-handed rotation about the vehicle Y axis, a situation where the main antenna is mounted lower than the aux antenna (assuming the default antenna setup) will result in a positive pitch.

parameter.name: SEP_PORT1_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run GPS Port.

parameter.name: SEP_PORT2_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for Secondary GPS port
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Secondary GPS port.

parameter.name: SEP_SAT_INFO
parameter.long_desc: Enable publication of satellite info (ORB_ID(satellite_info)) if possible.

parameter.name: SEP_STREAM_LOG
parameter.short_desc: Logging stream used during automatic configuration
parameter.long_desc: The stream the autopilot sets up on the receiver to output the logging data. Set this to another value if the default stream is already used for another purpose.

parameter.name: SEP_STREAM_MAIN
parameter.short_desc: Main stream used during automatic configuration
parameter.long_desc: The stream the autopilot sets up on the receiver to output the main data. Set this to another value if the default stream is already used for another purpose.

parameter.name: SEP_YAW_OFFS
parameter.short_desc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameter.long_desc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the rover antenna is in front. The offset angle increases clockwise. Set this to 90 if the rover antenna is placed on the right side of the vehicle and the moving base antenna is on the left side.

parameter.name: RC_CRSF_PRT_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for CRSF RC Input Driver
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run CRSF RC Input Driver. Crossfire RC (CRSF) driver.

parameter.name: RC_DSM_PRT_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for DSM RC Input Driver
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run DSM RC Input Driver. DSM RC (Spektrum) driver.

parameter.name: RC_GHST_PRT_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for GHST RC Input Driver
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run GHST RC Input Driver. Ghost (GHST) RC driver.

parameter.name: RC_PORT_CONFIG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for RC Input Driver
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run RC Input Driver. Setting this to 'Disabled' will use a board-specific default port for RC input.

parameter.name: RC_SBUS_PRT_CFG
parameter.short_desc: Serial Configuration for SBUS RC Input Driver
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run SBUS RC Input Driver. SBUS RC driver.

parameter.name: SER_EXT2_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the EXT2 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the EXT2 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_GPS1_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the GPS 1 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the GPS 1 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_GPS2_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the GPS 2 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the GPS 2 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_GPS3_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the GPS 3 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the GPS 3 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_MXS_BAUD
parameter.long_desc: Baudrate for the Serial Port connected to the MXS Transponder

parameter.name: SER_RC_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the Radio Controller Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the Radio Controller Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_TEL1_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the TELEM 1 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the TELEM 1 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_TEL2_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the TELEM 2 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the TELEM 2 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_TEL3_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the TELEM 3 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the TELEM 3 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_TEL4_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the TELEM/SERIAL 4 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the TELEM/SERIAL 4 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_URT6_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the UART 6 Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the UART 6 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SER_WIFI_BAUD
parameter.short_desc: Baudrate for the Wifi Port Serial Port
parameter.long_desc: Configure the Baudrate for the Wifi Port Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameter.name: SIH_DISTSNSR_OVR
parameter.short_desc: if >= 0 the distance sensor measures will be overridden by this value
parameter.long_desc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable distance sensor

parameter.name: SIH_IXX
parameter.long_desc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_IXY
parameter.long_desc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IXZ
parameter.long_desc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IYY
parameter.long_desc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_IYZ
parameter.long_desc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IZZ
parameter.long_desc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_KDV
parameter.long_desc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules. The greater this value, the slower the quad will move. Drag force function of velocity: D=-KDV*V. The maximum freefall velocity can be computed as V=10*MASS/KDV [m/s]

parameter.name: SIH_KDW
parameter.long_desc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules during rotations. The greater this value, the slower the quad will rotate. Aerodynamic moment function of body rate: Ma=-KDW*W_B. This value can be set to 0 if unknown.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_H0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the Above Mean Sea Level (AMSL) altitude where the simulation begins. If using FlightGear as a visual animation, this value can be tweaked such that the vehicle lies on the ground at takeoff. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_LAT0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the North-South location on Earth where the simulation begins. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_LON0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the East-West location on Earth where the simulation begins. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_L_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: This is the arm length generating the pitching moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the front and rear motors.

parameter.name: SIH_L_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: This is the arm length generating the rolling moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the left and right motors.

parameter.name: SIH_MASS
parameter.long_desc: This value can be measured by weighting the quad on a scale.

parameter.name: SIH_Q_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum torque delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about few percent of the maximum thrust force.

parameter.name: SIH_T_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum force delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about 5 times the mass of the quadrotor.

parameter.name: SIH_T_TAU
parameter.long_desc: the time taken for the thruster to step from 0 to 100% should be about 4 times tau

parameter.name: SIM_AGP_FAIL
parameter.long_desc: Stuck: freeze the measurement to the current location Drift: add a linearly growing bias to the sensor data

parameter.name: SIM_GPS_USED
parameter.short_desc: simulated GPS number of satellites used

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameter.long_desc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameter.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameter.short_desc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temperature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameter.name: SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.

parameter.name: SYS_FAILURE_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_GPS
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a GPS
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the system has no GPS. If disabled, the sensors hub will not process sensor_gps, and GPS will not be available for the rest of the system.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameter.long_desc: Set this to 0 if the board has no magnetometer. If set to 0, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer, otherwise N sensors are required.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_NUM_ASPD
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has an airspeed sensor
parameter.long_desc: Set this to 0 if the board has no airspeed sensor. If set to 0, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of an airspeed sensor.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_NUM_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Number of distance sensors to check being available
parameter.long_desc: The preflight check will fail if fewer than this number of distance sensors with valid data is present. Disable the check with 0.

parameter.name: SYS_HITL
parameter.short_desc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameter.long_desc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameter.name: SYS_PARAM_VER
parameter.long_desc: This is used internally only: an airframe configuration might set an expected parameter version value via PARAM_DEFAULTS_VER. This is checked on bootup against SYS_PARAM_VER, and if they do not match, parameters are reset and reloaded from the airframe configuration.

parameter.name: SYS_RGB_MAXBRT
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for maximum brightness

parameter.name: TEL_BST_EN
parameter.long_desc: If true, the FMU will try to connect to Blacksheep telemetry on start up

parameter.name: TEL_FRSKY_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run FrSky Telemetry.

parameter.name: TEL_HOTT_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run HoTT Telemetry.
